commit_message:
Add a "libvirt_disk_prefix" flag to libvirt driver

This change makes possible to override the default the prefix
that should be used in a particular installation (refers to
lp question 176978).

Change-Id: I06b9e7251dc4a02ef6ac40393dce9c5755b00614

lock/unlock in compute manager to use uuids

Related to blueprint internal-uuids. lock and unlock already solely use uuids so
I updated the variable names and tests to illustrate this.

commit_message:
suspend/resume in compute manager to use uuids

Related to blueprint internal-uuids. Changes suspend_instance and resume_instance
to expect and handle instance uuids instead of instance ids.

Change-Id: Ib61806bef3a95275109c68aefe775f332e13d35a

commit_message:
Bug #890399

- Made create service calls to fail when there is no service name.
- Along the way fixed incorrect equality checks for a string for various other calls.
- Added tests to other api calls that were also failing
- Made ==None checks to is None checks

Change-Id: I2fa30442c60667b793ebca30efd9f79253fc740e

commit_message:
Additional documentation

blueprint keystone-documentation

Added use case flows in the doc/design folder showing these scenarios:
- User only knows Keystone URL and not their tenant or Nova URL
- User knows their tenant; shortcut of first scenario
- User knows Nova URL only and wants to authenticate

Also added Middleware Architecture explanation to RST docs showing
the many supported deployment scenarios.

Change-Id: I308ac26b2b8748e8a80f4c5952f8311f99d50b40

commit_message:
Adding bulk create fixed ips. The true issue here
is the creation of IPs in the DB that are not
currently used(we are building the entire block).
This fix is just a bandaid, but it does cut ~25
seconds off of the quantum tests on my laptop.

(pre)$ ./run_tests.sh -N nova.tests.test_quantum:QuantumNovaIPAMTestCase
QuantumNovaIPAMTestCase
    test_allocate_and_deallocate_instance_dynamic               OK  11.36
    test_allocate_and_deallocate_instance_static                OK  11.27
    test_create_and_delete_nets                                 OK  10.35
    test_validate_bad_network                                   OK  0.10

(post)$ ./run_tests.sh -N nova.tests.test_quantum:QuantumNovaIPAMTestCase
QuantumNovaIPAMTestCase
    test_allocate_and_deallocate_instance_dynamic               OK  2.94
    test_allocate_and_deallocate_instance_static                OK  3.12
    test_create_and_delete_nets                                 OK  1.86
    test_validate_bad_network                                   OK  0.11

(cherry picked from commit fcbb8780386b3ff48653da23a1ffb3f5aa0c8b13)

Change-Id: I46b629f9ca6e019c7c4c6aa8e869c551e5c13fb8

[{'created': '2011-11-15 07:46:44.000000000', 'message': "Adds function to count tab characters in files to run_test.sh.

In case you're frustrated by mixed use of tab characters and
spaces for indentation, this function finds tab characters in
all the Python, CSS, Javascript and HTML files in the project,
and lists out any offending files that contain tabs.

Returns proper exit codes in case we someday want to gate on
this check.

Change-Id: I70195e9d00368a5d177cd3792921028e0bcd9b53
"}]
commit_message:
Adds function to count tab characters in files to run_test.sh.

In case you're frustrated by mixed use of tab characters and
spaces for indentation, this function finds tab characters in
all the Python, CSS, Javascript and HTML files in the project,
and lists out any offending files that contain tabs.

Returns proper exit codes in case we someday want to gate on
this check.

Change-Id: I70195e9d00368a5d177cd3792921028e0bcd9b53

commit_message:
Revert api_key change in novaclient Client argument

Fixes bug 891442

Also, still need to support NOVA_API_KEY environment variable for now.
Bump version to 2.6.8 so we can get this into pypi
Updated setup.py to build properly

Change-Id: I16233ac559bf44b78666118d68975509da6bfb0d

commit_message:
Massive UI fixes + bugfixes.

All forms/modals on the site now inherit from a single
standardized modal base template.

All cancel buttons now go to appropriate pages.

All buttons are styled approriately

Fixed many bugs in the networks, volumes and users panels.

Generally made everything more standardized, uniform, and DRY.

Moved mox.VerifyAll() to global tearDown() method to prevent
tests carelessly forgetting it, and/or VerifyAll() raising
errors that prevent UnsetStubs() from running properly.

Fixed a lot of failing unit tests that weren't being verified.

Change-Id: I9f7a87870a89f83373cd480255b0906c00cff032

commit_message:
pause/unpause in compute manager to use uuids

Related to blueprint internal-uuids. Changes pause_instance and unpause_instance
to expect and handle instance uuids instead of instance ids.

Change-Id: I4f601f686dcaa6d6268d1dd01557a0362a0a89fa

saved instance, so they are now undefined in addition to running

With test case

commit_message:
Undefine libvirt saved instances

Fixes bug 814561

Adding a call to managedSaveRemove if the instance has a
saved instance, so they are now undefined in addition to running
instances during destroy
With test case

Also added myself to Authors

(cherry picked from commit ad7fcf225e126d2a719c04019c4daa1616d2159e)

Change-Id: I760a15d2ab135d7c3d638ca3c4358d8600582411

commit_message:
Fix for launchpad bug #882568

Use tunctl to create the tap device if we are on a system where the ip command
is too old (and doesn't have support for tuntap).

(cherry picked from commit e4c74596bfaf1cee1a6f8cbb0d97aa067d9a4317)

Change-Id: I9e22010e4c7dd2671267de6d0e7a7bc9ae76a854

subject: Change floating-snat to float-snat
messages:
[{'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-11-16 07:38:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Change floating-snat to float-snat

With iptables v1.4.10 I'm running into an issue with the chain length of the
"nova-dhcpbridge-floating-snat" table (iptables it complaining that the name
is too long; 28 chars max).  This shortens the name of that table.

(cherry picked from commit 8700a97b701136e13c7ef959f13c89a3b7462fdb)

Change-Id: I00b1003aaa0b3771c29d6459d07023a8caa47706

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-16 07:20:57.000000000', 'message': "Bug 884863: nova logs everything to syslog twice

Fix double-registration of the syslog handler.
NovaRootLogger.setup_from_flags is called twice from log.setup() -- once
through NovaRootLogger.__init__ and once through reset().  setup_from_flags
wasn't idempotent, so this resulted in the syslog handler being registered
twice.

Rather than fix the twisty-turny maze that is setup(), I've opted to make
setup_from_flags idempotent in this regard, by always unregistering the
syslog handler before doing anything else.

(cherry picked from commit a807c57f5b61cb25a6f5c140a97ed744ab0a70dd)

Change-Id: I59ad61751e1a19d2cbb73dc1deea9c708d4c5032
"}]
commit_message:
Bug 884863: nova logs everything to syslog twice

Fix double-registration of the syslog handler.
NovaRootLogger.setup_from_flags is called twice from log.setup() -- once
through NovaRootLogger.__init__ and once through reset().  setup_from_flags
wasn't idempotent, so this resulted in the syslog handler being registered
twice.

Rather than fix the twisty-turny maze that is setup(), I've opted to make
setup_from_flags idempotent in this regard, by always unregistering the
syslog handler before doing anything else.

(cherry picked from commit a807c57f5b61cb25a6f5c140a97ed744ab0a70dd)

Change-Id: I59ad61751e1a19d2cbb73dc1deea9c708d4c5032

commit_message:
Add local storage of context for logging

commit_message:
Add .gitreview config file for gerrit.

The CI team is developing a new tool, git-review:

  https://github.com/openstack-ci/git-review

which is intendend to replace rfc.sh.  This adds a .gitreview file
so that it can automatically determine the canonical gerrit location
for the repository when first run.  Later, rfc.sh will be updated to
indicate it is deprecated, and then eventually removed.

(cherry picked from commit adffdf2df98dadd884b1969ba45e9fdb0b4e9266)

Change-Id: Ifc1d34143b1b90faa4324f7750bfc43f69a5f494

commit_message:
Fix deletion of instances without fixed ips.

Catch exception when there are no fixed ips for an instance when deallocating it.

When trying to delete failed builds I got the following traces:

(nova.rpc): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/rpc/impl_kombu.py", line 620, in _process_data
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     rval = node_func(context=ctxt, **node_args)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/network/manager.py", line 252, in deallocate_for_instance
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     fixed_ips = self.db.fixed_ip_get_by_instance(context, instance_id)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/db/api.py", line 392, in fixed_ip_get_by_instance
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     return IMPL.fixed_ip_get_by_instance(context, instance_id)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py", line 120, in wrapper
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     return f(*args, **kwargs)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py", line 877, in fixed_ip_get_by_instance
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     raise exception.FixedIpNotFoundForInstance(instance_id=instance_id)
(nova.rpc): TRACE: FixedIpNotFoundForInstance: Instance 37 has zero fixed ips.

Which this commit fixes.

Added myself to Authors as requested.

(cherry picked from commit 636c70c3c990d0405c7e05a428d78908dc8b4317)

Change-Id: I87a1764c16328c6a4bfa5a0bfab1ea4800cbb355

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-04 14:35:31.000000000', 'message': 'Refactoring/cleanup of some view builders.

I have re-worked the "addresses", "flavors", "images", and "servers" view
builders to share logic which was previously duplicated across many ViewBuilder
classes. Also, I have re-worked the ViewBuilder class in general to persist
longer (meaning that a new ViewBuilder is not created for every request but
rather a single ViewBuilder is created and deals with each request as needed.)

During the re-factor I found an issue with test_servers.py where links were not
containing the project_id like they should. This was fixed and tests were updated.

Overall we had good test coverage so not many tests had to be updated during
the refactor.

Change-Id: I034404892018e99987f80789d7f7e406ff31658c
'}, {'created': '2011-11-04 16:58:02.000000000', 'message': 'Refactoring/cleanup of some view builders.

commit_message:
Refactoring/cleanup of some view builders.

I have re-worked the "addresses", "flavors", "images", and "servers" view
builders to share logic which was previously duplicated across many ViewBuilder
classes. Also, I have re-worked the ViewBuilder class in general to persist
longer.

Overall we had good test coverage so not many tests had to be updated during
the refactor.

(Patch Set 2) Updated _set_request and _get_request to be a request property
              and a set_request method which can be overridden.
(Patch Set 3) Fixed tests that I broke with the last update.
(Patch Set 4) Changed "id in network.keys()" to "id in network"
(Patch Set 5) Feedback changes from bcwaldon
(Patch Set 6) Updated based on feedback from Waldon.
(Patch Set 7) Feedback from s1rp (Rick Harris)

Change-Id: I034404892018e99987f80789d7f7e406ff31658c

commit_message:
Separate metadata api into its own service

part 1 of blueprint separate-nova-metadata

 * adds api/metadata/ and moves code from ec2
 * moves metadata into separate binary
 * changes metadata forward to use metadata host and port
 * moves the metadata accept rule to the metadata api
 * adds nova-api-* to setup.py

Change-Id: I7f5d8e6cafc55b5c383cd88991f29c6059fb8d82

commit_message:
bug #891267 : for XS, grab iface-id from XAPI directly if needed.

The version of OVS that ships with XenServer by default does not include
the script to automatically sync the XAPI other_config:nicira-iface-id
field of a VIF with the external_ids:iface-id in the OVS interfaces table.
Thus, make the agent grab the value directly from XAPI if iface-id is
not already populated.

Change-Id: Id01d9da1761016bcd983ad06621c62e94b2445c1

This looks good Mark'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2011-11-15 21:21:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2011-11-15 21:23:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 693, 'date': '2011-11-15 23:24:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

This should definitely have unittests before being submitted."}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2011-11-16 05:27:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Thanks for taking a look. Can I press you to provide an example of the functionality you would want unit-tested here? My philosophy here is that since this code is a wrapper for command line tools, it is a peripheral unit and thus is most properly covered by functional testing (which I am performing in SmokeStack using the torpedo project). But I'm definitely open to making improvements!"}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-11-16 21:00:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

While I'm normally in the camp of "require unit tests" I'm not sure it applys here for some of the reasons Mark states. I'd love to get unit tests in here but I'm not going to make him create the unit test framework from scratch for this change.

This adds much needed logging and error handling to the xenstore plugin.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-11-16 21:10:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, approved

Looks good to me.

Agree with the comments that adding unit tests to these plugins at this time is probably a bit much just to get this changeset in. These plugins are mostly acting as wrappers and have some odd requirements as well (they are Python 2.4).'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-16 21:19:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-16 19:35:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add .gitreview config file for gerrit.

The CI team is developing a new tool, git-review:

https://github.com/openstack-ci/git-review

which is intendend to replace rfc.sh. This adds a .gitreview file
so that it can automatically determine the canonical gerrit location
for the repository when first run. Later, rfc.sh will be updated to
indicate it is deprecated, and then eventually removed.

Change-Id: Ia88ba61c320a98ce89061f658c740a31136c6732
'}]
commit_message:
Add .gitreview config file for gerrit.

The CI team is developing a new tool, git-review:

https://github.com/openstack-ci/git-review

which is intendend to replace rfc.sh. This adds a .gitreview file
so that it can automatically determine the canonical gerrit location
for the repository when first run. Later, rfc.sh will be updated to
indicate it is deprecated, and then eventually removed.

Change-Id: Ia88ba61c320a98ce89061f658c740a31136c6732

commit_message:
Adding middleware tests

Middleware tests start a fake echo app and put the auth_token.py
middleware in front of it and then simulate calls. The tests
check the correct response for unauthenticated calls and also
that the right headers are being passed down to the fake app from
the middleware (the fake app echos the headers it receives)

Includes fixes discovered in testing and non-breaking fix
for Bug 878431

Update testing options to support verbosity and selecting
individual tests

Addresses bug 890777

Fixes to middleware tests that were hanging Jenkins
- needed to add support for SSL tests

Change-Id: Iea273196f1782653eccdcf0f2391eacb1434aa8e

[{'created': '2011-11-16 17:23:13.000000000', 'message': 'Add .gitreview config file for gerrit.

The CI team is developing a new tool, git-review:

https://github.com/openstack-ci/git-review

which is intendend to replace rfc.sh. This adds a .gitreview file
so that it can automatically determine the canonical gerrit location
for the repository when first run.

Change-Id: I4d71e9a8b5463e29449a3da2739a15f40970354b
'}]
commit_message:
Add .gitreview config file for gerrit.

The CI team is developing a new tool, git-review:

https://github.com/openstack-ci/git-review

which is intendend to replace rfc.sh. This adds a .gitreview file
so that it can automatically determine the canonical gerrit location
for the repository when first run.

Change-Id: I4d71e9a8b5463e29449a3da2739a15f40970354b

commit_message:
Fixes bug 890206

Add a check when creating the volume definition for the libvirt manager
to use the apporpiate driver for the disk, according to [1].

[1] http://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsDisks

I recently added update logic which had a severely faulty
assumption. That assumption was that an instnace object was

case we'll have to revisit this logic.

Change-Id: Ib2303d8719d2f3f8b5c123168864c97d64881544
"}]
commit_message:
Remove hostname update() logic in compute.API

I recently added update logic which had a severely faulty
assumption. That assumption was that an instnace object was
always going to be passed to update(). Since that is not the
case we'll have to revisit this logic.

Change-Id: Ib2303d8719d2f3f8b5c123168864c97d64881544

commit_message:
Log original dropped exception when a new exception occurs

If a exception is caught while processing a previous exception, make sure
to log it so it doesn't silently get discarded

Cherry-picked from e2403739d5e866e011ecc45a4d5b20d5e0192997.

Change-Id: Ic887db9c2592229970737daf5dd9732b2258877b

subject: Fix exception reraising in volume manager.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 24, 'name': 'Chuck Short', 'email': 'charles.short@windriver.com', 'username': 'zulcss'}, {'_account_id': 321, 'name': 'Lorin Hochstein', 'email': 'lorinh@gmail.com', 'username': 'lorinh'}, {'_account_id': 708, 'name': 'Yuriy Taraday', 'email': 'yorik.sar@gmail.com', 'username': 'yorik-sar'}, {'_account_id': 1132, 'name': 'Brian Waldon', 'email': 'brian@waldon.cc', 'username': 'bcwaldon'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-21 16:05:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

looks sensible enough.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2011-10-23 13:47:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

How does this patch change the behavior of re-raising exceptions from the original? (I'm not familiar enough with Python exception semantics to see the difference, and there's no bug explicitly linked that describes the problem this is fixing)."}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2011-10-24 07:36:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The raise statement without parameters is to raise exception with type, value and traceback stored somewhere in sys.exc_info(). If you raise and catch exception inside except: block, stored values will be replaced with new ones. And if some fastidious person call sys.exc_clear(), bare raise statement will raise TypeError because you can not raise None value.

Some figures:
1. bare raise is equivalent to:
  _exc_info = sys.exc_info()
  raise _exc_info[0], _exc_info[1], _exc_info[2]

2. re-raising of wrong exception example:
  try:
    raise Exception('aa')
  except:
    try:
      raise Exception('bb')
    except:
      pass
    raise # Will raise Exception('bb')

3. TypeError example (which actually took place in our place):
  try:
    raise Exception('aa')
  except:
    try:
      raise Exception('bb')
    except:
      sys.exc_clear()
    raise # Will raise TypeError

4. find 10 differences with snippet of code from VolumeManager:
  try:
    self.driver.do_something(volume)
  except:
    self.db.mark_as_error(volume)
    raise

There is some exception raised and handled without trace in sys.exc_info() somewhere in SQLAlchemy code, and so raise statement results in TypeError, which is logged instead of our exception."}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2011-10-24 11:11:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Gotcha, makes sense.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-24 16:11:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2011-10-26 14:56:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2011-10-26 14:57:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Can someone make Jenkins to merge this change?'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-10-26 16:22:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not submit

Yuri, thanks for the fix, but please submit it against the master branch first and we will consider backporting it to the stable branch

See http://wiki.openstack.org/StableBranch - "The branch is intended to be a safe source of fixes for significant issues which have been fixed on master since the release."

It's really important to get the fix into master, otherwise it will still be broken in the next release!'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2011-10-27 10:01:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I've created a new change against master: https://review.openstack.org/1128"}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2011-11-11 10:33:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2011-11-11 10:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

https://review.openstack.org/1128 was merge into master. Now we can backport it.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-11-16 13:11:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Thanks Yuriy, but please test your backport - the save_and_reraise_exception() function doesn't even exist on the stable branch"}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2011-11-16 13:13:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

That's why this change depends on the second one that backports this method."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-11-16 13:13:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: No score

Ah, nevermind - I see you've backported that as a separate patch. Sorry! :)"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-11-16 13:29:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Looks good, apart from other patch needs fixing and please include this in the commit message

(cherry picked from commit 459dd3ed596cb919bc942ebe884ed376b32e63be)"}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2011-11-16 14:34:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-11-16 14:44:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, approved

Thanks Yuriy'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-16 14:54:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-unittests/13/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-merge/407/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/1782/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-16 15:04:28.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Removed some cruft.

Removed builddeb.sh - we don't use it.
Removed a reference to pep8 skipping vcsversion due to bzr bug.
Updated sqlalchemy in the pip-requires to allow/use 0.7.1 or later to match
Nova installs.

commit_message:
Changes to make pip-based tests work with jenkins.

The git line for the cisco pip-requires was wrong.
The venv needs to be installed in the source tree, not in the home
directory for self-contained builds.
The version of python can't be assumed and must be calculated.

Change-Id: I23d381eb273e82796e309483086dc68f27ce6093

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-14 19:06:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes LP Bug#885341 - Test failure in TestImageCacheManageXattr

This bug was due to insufficient checking that not only was
python-xattr installed, but also the device that the image
cache dir lives in is actually able to have xattrs written
to files (user_xattr in fstab). The fix adds a number of checks
for xattr support on the device, both in the image cache configure()
methods and in the test cases themselves (using @skip_if_disabled)

Adds a functional test case for queue/prefetch of images into
the image cache.

Change-Id: I09b3d008fc00564031b0534155430ed0856e9e9c
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes LP Bug#885341 - Test failure in TestImageCacheManageXattr

This bug was due to insufficient checking that not only was
python-xattr installed, but also the device that the image
cache dir lives in is actually able to have xattrs written
to files (user_xattr in fstab). The fix adds a number of checks
for xattr support on the device, both in the image cache configure()
methods and in the test cases themselves (using @skip_if_disabled)

Adds a functional test case for queue/prefetch of images into
the image cache.

Change-Id: I09b3d008fc00564031b0534155430ed0856e9e9c

Converts nova/containers, nova/floating_ips, nova/images

Change-Id: Ib1604665d9a0c4d9fe971af9c22ff6c09bbb35ea

commit_message:
Modal form abstraction and cleanup. Bug fixes.

Modal forms now inherit from a _modal_form.html template,
and the guts of form presentation are abstracted to
_form_fields.html to be more DRY.

Converts nova/containers, nova/floating_ips, nova/images
and nova/instances to use the new style.

Fixed image ownership bug. Fixed server descriptions bug.

Change-Id: Ib1604665d9a0c4d9fe971af9c22ff6c09bbb35ea

commit_message:
Follow hostname RFCs

Updated hostname sanitization method to more closely follow RFC-952
and RFC-1123. Also moved it to nova.utils, where it seems to fit
better.

Fixes bug 885374

(Patch Set 1) Updated hostname sanitization with more efficient and
              [opinion] more readable implementation.

Change-Id: I60d7ee89867c05950bec1fd53b072a1c6247ebea

subject: Bug #886353: Faults raised by OpenStack API Resource handlers fail to be reported properly
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 100, 'name': 'Johannes Erdfelt', 'email': 'johannes@erdfelt.com', 'username': 'johannes.erdfelt'}, {'_account_id': 271, 'name': 'Ewan Mellor', 'email': 'ewan.mellor@citrix.com', 'username': 'ewanmellor'}, {'_account_id': 321, 'name': 'Lorin Hochstein', 'email': 'lorinh@gmail.com', 'username': 'lorinh'}, {'_account_id': 475, 'name': 'Rick Harris', 'email': 'rick.harris@rackspace.com', 'username': 'rconradharris'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 693, 'name': 'Christopher MacGown', 'email': 'chris@pistoncloud.com', 'username': '0x44'}, {'_account_id': 706, 'name': 'Brian Lamar', 'email': 'brian.lamar@rackspace.com', 'username': 'blamar'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-04 21:13:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks OK...'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2011-11-04 21:27:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Do you know where faults.Fault() is being raised in a resource handler?

I recently cleaned up a lot of unnecessary usage because of similar problems and I can't immediately see how this can still happen."}, {'account_id': 271, 'date': '2011-11-04 22:20:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I was seeing the Fault raised by an extension -- https://github.com/cloudbuilders/openstackx/blob/master/extensions/admin.py.  I presume that this is legitimate usage of Fault -- it looks fine to me.

I don't know for sure whether RateLimitingMiddleware's 'Too many requests' exception would come through Resource.__call__, but it looks plausible, depending on your pipeline config of course.  If so, that would be another occurrence."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2011-11-04 22:27:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I don't think that is the correct usage of faults.Fault(). It's really only there to provide JSON/XML fault responses. I removed all of the uses of faults.Fault() in extensions recently. The use in extensions was inconsistent with the rest of the "core" nova code (which never used faults.Fault()), it hides useful type information (as all wrappers tend to do) and it also is more typing for no benefit.

I kind of wish there was a different way of handling the original purpose of faults.Fault() since the current implementation has caused confusion (witnessed by it's use in a handful of extensions).

I'm ok with the patch in general. It's small and makes the code more tolerant of incorrect usage of faults.Fault(), but  I think your bug is really in the extension.'}, {'account_id': 271, 'date': '2011-11-04 22:39:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Could you put a doc-comment on Fault with these details?  You're talking about the 'original purpose' of Fault, but it's completely undocumented what it's for, so it's not surprising that people are misusing it.  You shouldn't have to spend your time tidying up after other people.

I'm not a fan of it myself -- it's just getting in my way when I'm debugging right now -- so if the right answer is for handlers to avoid it then that's fine by me.  A comment to that effect would be great.  Thanks."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2011-11-07 18:37:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Here's a change to clean up the docstrings a little bit.

https://review.openstack.org/1387"}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-11-08 23:00:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Makes a lot of sense to me. I'd very much like to see a test along with this to protect against future issues."}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2011-11-09 02:53:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Makes sense.'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2011-11-15 20:30:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 693, 'date': '2011-11-15 22:43:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, approved

This has like a million +1s, merging.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-15 22:51:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build Successful

https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-merge/403/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/1778/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-15 22:51:52.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-04 21:07:55.000000000', 'message': "Bug #886353: Faults raised by OpenStack API Resource handlers fail to be reported properly

In Resource.__call__, catch any faults.Fault that are thrown by the request
handler, and make those the action_result.  This means that the Fault doesn't
fall into the exception handler below (faults.Fault is a subclass of
webob.exc.HTTPException) and so we don't attempt to wrap a Fault in a Fault.

Change-Id: Ica31723ddd621332ec4be75db0d675bc98905e43
"}]
commit_message:
Bug #886353: Faults raised by OpenStack API Resource handlers fail to be reported properly

In Resource.__call__, catch any faults.Fault that are thrown by the request
handler, and make those the action_result.  This means that the Fault doesn't
fall into the exception handler below (faults.Fault is a subclass of
webob.exc.HTTPException) and so we don't attempt to wrap a Fault in a Fault.

Change-Id: Ica31723ddd621332ec4be75db0d675bc98905e43

subject: Bug #888719: openvswitch-nova runs after firstboot scripts
messages:
[{'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-10 20:24:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Code looks fine, but this really needs to be independent of other pending patches, particularly given that the two patches do not touch any common code.  Please remember to use independent branches for your patch development—and never develop in your master branch, lest you anger the Gerrit!"}, {'account_id': 271, 'date': '2011-11-10 20:45:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Sorry Kevin, you lost me.  Which branches is this not independent of?  And what makes you say that is was developed in master (it wasn't)?"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-10 20:53:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah, my bad on the branch comment; I misread the header above, and I might be a little loopy due to a head cold %)

As for independent, however—if you look at the top-level for the change, there's a block indicating that this change has a dependency on a prior change you submitted.  Given that that other change had a new patch set submitted at about the same time this change was submitted, and given that that other patch set had no changes relative to its prior patch set, I concluded that the two were not independently developed.  The error might have been as small as branching off a development branch instead of off master, but the end result is that there's this dependency chain there that's not really necessary and that could block this patch from going in until the other is accepted…which, for independent patches, is likely undesirable.  (I could see where we might want to use that for some things, but so far we haven't…)

Anyway, as I said, the change looks good, so if you can figure out how to untangle the dependency chain, I think you'll be good to go."}, {'account_id': 271, 'date': '2011-11-10 21:58:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 271, 'date': '2011-11-10 22:00:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Got you.  I must have taken one topic branch from another one.  That would also explain the weird resubmission on the other review that I wasn't expecting.  Sorry about that.

I think it's fixed now."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-10 22:03:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

No problem :)'}, {'account_id': 271, 'date': '2011-11-11 19:54:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 271, 'date': '2011-11-11 19:55:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Rebased.  It looked like the previous one wasn't based properly on master, so I've rebased it before Gerrit even gets a chance to tell me off.

No change to the patch itself."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-11 20:15:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2011-11-15 22:18:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, approved

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-15 22:27:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-unittests/8/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-merge/402/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/1777/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-15 22:27:08.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-10 20:13:07.000000000', 'message': "Bug #888719: openvswitch-nova runs after firstboot scripts

Move openvswitch-nova to 23 in the boot order.

The openvswitch-nova init.d script used on XenServer has been set to run
at 96 in the boot order (i.e. very late).  This is inconvenient, because it
means that it runs after the firstboot scripts, so if you want to do an
automated install of a compute VM, say, you can't rely on the Open vSwitch
rules being ready.

23 places it after the networking start up (9 through 14) and before the
firstboot scripts (24).

Change-Id: I5c4f2f02c78bd7b8ccc6cac4d6549209a6dcbdb0
"}, {'created': '2011-11-10 21:58:15.000000000', 'message': "Bug #888719: openvswitch-nova runs after firstboot scripts

23 places it after the networking start up (9 through 14) and before the

Change-Id: I5c4f2f02c78bd7b8ccc6cac4d6549209a6dcbdb0
"}, {'created': '2011-11-11 19:54:20.000000000', 'message': "Bug #888719: openvswitch-nova runs after firstboot scripts

Change-Id: I5c4f2f02c78bd7b8ccc6cac4d6549209a6dcbdb0
"}]
commit_message:
Bug #888719: openvswitch-nova runs after firstboot scripts

Move openvswitch-nova to 23 in the boot order.

The openvswitch-nova init.d script used on XenServer has been set to run
at 96 in the boot order (i.e. very late).  This is inconvenient, because it
means that it runs after the firstboot scripts, so if you want to do an
automated install of a compute VM, say, you can't rely on the Open vSwitch
rules being ready.

23 places it after the networking start up (9 through 14) and before the
firstboot scripts (24).

Change-Id: I5c4f2f02c78bd7b8ccc6cac4d6549209a6dcbdb0

commit_message:
Remove contrib/nova.sh and other stale docs.

Removed contrib/nova.sh and any references to it in the RST docs.

removed refernece to old livecd that has nova circa 2010 on it.

.gitignore'ing some additional autogenerated doc files.

Change-Id: I7a07a58a9a6f1112fc7e486367a06f6916207784

subject: Fixes Bug #861293 nova.auth.signer.Signer now honors the SignatureMethod parameter for SHA1 when creating signatures
messages:
[{'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-09-28 21:23:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(2 inline comments)

The problem with the original code is that it was written for the client side

As the server, we can and should require that SignatureMethod is set. Also, if HMAC-256 isn't available to us and the client supplies a signature that uses it, we should return an error.

http://aws.amazon.com/articles/1928 - "You must set the SignatureMethod request parameter to either HmacSHA256 or HmacSHA1"'}, {'account_id': 1610, 'date': '2011-09-29 10:08:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1610, 'date': '2011-09-29 10:09:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

Cheers Mark. Changes made.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-09-29 11:56:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

this appears to allow multiple auth versions to be specified at the same time (swift -1 -2 ...)

Perhaps the options should update the same variable internally to avoid corner cases when both are specified. Using one "auth_version" variable will also make adding future versions (auth v3?) simpler. Also, along the same lines, you are checking the versions against the integers "1" and "2" rather than strings. This is fine if we only have 1 and 2, but as soon as we need support for 1.1 or similar, this will break.'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2011-10-24 16:51:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2011-10-24 17:45:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Add support for OS Auth API version 2

Add a switch -2 to allow authenticate against service providing
OpenStack auth version 2.0 (ie: keystone).

By default it will authenticate against v1.0 and you can explicitely
force it by adding a --auth-version 1 if in future we decide to set 2.0
auth as default.

It will handle the format tenant:user to indentify to a specific tenant,
if this format is not specified it will assume user is the same as
tenant.

Change-Id: I4684ec1e0950a1dae6935486aa730eaf13d6cd46

subject: Refactored headers produced by middleware (bug 835087)
messages:
[{'account_id': 8, 'date': '2011-11-11 16:27:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Why do you want to keep a header that is not yet implemented??
HTTP_X_CAPABILITIES
What is the value out of it? What if the design changes?'}, {'account_id': 8, 'date': '2011-11-11 16:30:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Also
HTTP_X_ROLES
Pending deprecation in favor of more granular X_CAPABILITY / X_CAPABILITIES
Comma delimited list of case-sensitive Roles

I don't think we should have futuristic details.This could mislead.
I would suggest explaining headers in their current incarnation."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-11-11 17:31:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-11-11 17:35:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Yogi: Agree, and updated.

I don't have a use case for adding X_USER_ID and X_USER_NAME, other than the fact that the presence of X_TENANT_ID and X_TENANT_NAME makes the old X_USER attribute a bit confusing. Open to feedback on that."}, {'account_id': 8, 'date': '2011-11-11 18:05:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Are you planning to keep all the three to ensure consistency?
HTTP_X_USER
HTTP_X_USER_ID
HTTP_X_USER_NAME
I see comments for all the three.Does the code has all th three?'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-11-11 19:32:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yes, I simply grouped the deprecated headers together in code.'}, {'account_id': 8, 'date': '2011-11-11 20:07:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, approved

commit_message:
Refactored headers produced by middleware (bug 835087)

- Renamed HTTP_X_ROLE to HTTP_X_ROLES (bug 835087)
- Simplified logic to build the list of roles
- Introduced HTTP_X_USER_ID and HTTP_X_USER_NAME headers
- Retained support for HTTP_X_USER and HTTP_X_ROLE, but
  documented them as *Deprecated*
- Documented all headers produced by middleware

Change-Id: I03fb45879ba3bf37d0bef1d0c110b44f55b7c10c

commit_message:
Deepcopy optparse defaults to avoid re-appending multistrings (#890489)

This is actually a bug in optparse itself, but luckily we can work
around it. I'll file it upstream when bugs.python.org's account
registration isn't broken.

Change-Id: I87c3271562caa4336c11fe445475650a9f16950c

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-15 07:55:26.000000000', 'message': "Fix multistring flags default handling (#890489)

With its 'append' action, optparse appends values to the supplied
default value. This leaves the user with no way of overriding the
default value. If you want to support overriding, you need to manually
handle setting the default value after parsing.

gflags supports overriding the default value so we must do the same.

Change-Id: I5810e16806e74876c7a310edbb6f8f27f0a3313b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix multistring flags default handling (#890489)

With its 'append' action, optparse appends values to the supplied
default value. This leaves the user with no way of overriding the
default value. If you want to support overriding, you need to manually
handle setting the default value after parsing.

gflags supports overriding the default value so we must do the same.

Change-Id: I5810e16806e74876c7a310edbb6f8f27f0a3313b

subject: changing config files to be on section 5 and also running spellchecks against all files
messages:
[{'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2011-10-13 19:42:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Doesn't the Author section usually specify the Author of the software rather than the Author of the manpage ?

IMHO do it like nmap and just link to the authors/changelog file:

-
AUTHOR
       Originally by Gordon “Fyodor” Lyon fyodor@insecure.org (http://insecure.org)

       Hundreds of people have made valuable contributions to Nmap over the years. These are
       detailed in the CHANGELOG.  file which is distributed with Nmap and also available from
       http://nmap.org/changelog.html.
-"}, {'account_id': 794, 'date': '2011-10-15 22:08:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2011-10-16 00:37:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

They all render ok.'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2011-10-19 19:16:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

The object, container, and account auditors need a little work . The description has an odd wording. See a better example below

Remove "basically" anywhere it exists (4 files).

swift-object-updater doesn't seem to have been updated properly (copy/pasted from swift-container-updater). Some references to containers should be changed to objects.

Example better description for the auditors (for the swift-account-auditor.1):

The account auditor crawls the local account system checking the integrity of accounts objects. If corruption is found (in the case of bit rot, for example), the file is quarantined, and replication will replace the bad file from another replica.'}, {'account_id': 794, 'date': '2011-10-26 20:37:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 794, 'date': '2011-10-27 02:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2011-11-03 19:35:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

account-server.conf -> s/services, such as; replicator/services such as the replicator/

account-server.conf -> s/encloused/enclosed/

account-server.conf -> s/This is the egg URI/This is the reference to the installed python egg/

account-server.conf -> s/ogging level/logging level/


I'm sure there are similar errors in the other ones, too."}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2011-11-03 19:36:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

should the conf file man pages be named *.5 (rather than *.1)?'}, {'account_id': 794, 'date': '2011-11-09 03:09:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2011-11-11 23:11:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Getting these in should provide a great starting point from which we can provide better docs for deployers.'}, {'account_id': 1009, 'date': '2011-11-14 19:15:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, approved

Build Successful

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-01 23:18:17.000000000', 'message': "Fixed time-sensitive tests.

I noticed that a couple of tests I recently made were
time-sensitive. This can be shown with the following quick
script:

from sys import exit
from unittest import TestSuite, TextTestRunner

from test.unit.obj.test_server import TestObjectController

s = TestSuite()
s.addTest(TestObjectController('test_GET_but_expired'))
s.addTest(TestObjectController('test_HEAD_but_expired'))
for x in xrange(200):
    if TextTestRunner().run(s).failures:
        exit('!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! TEST FAILED !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!')
print '\o/ Test ran 200 times without failure.'

Change-Id: Ifdb1920e5266aaa278baa0759fc0bfaa1aff2d0d
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed time-sensitive tests.

I noticed that a couple of tests I recently made were
time-sensitive. This can be shown with the following quick
script:

from sys import exit
from unittest import TestSuite, TextTestRunner

from test.unit.obj.test_server import TestObjectController

s = TestSuite()
s.addTest(TestObjectController('test_GET_but_expired'))
s.addTest(TestObjectController('test_HEAD_but_expired'))
for x in xrange(200):
    if TextTestRunner().run(s).failures:
        exit('!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! TEST FAILED !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!')
print '\o/ Test ran 200 times without failure.'

Change-Id: Ifdb1920e5266aaa278baa0759fc0bfaa1aff2d0d

messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Sorry, I couldn't see how to respond to everyone else and I didn't realize it was by reviewing myself. I'm thinking along the lines as you Waldon as the directory structure, and I'll re-prop everything with a new structure when the naming poll ends in a few hours. For those not using Keystone auth, I added a flag in the os.config (TB renamed) file for native or keystone auth. I also added feature flags for if the environment is resize capable and if imaging/backups are enabled in the target test environment. I also made a bug fix that Nachi caught with authentication."}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

tried to fix your pep8 issues, but it wouldn't let me submit that back for review on your change. I've pushed them into a branch I have if you want the updates: 

https://github.com/heckj/openstack-integration-tests/tree/review/daryl_walleck/zodiac-test-merge

git fetch those into place and you should be good."}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

added change set that fixes the various pep8 violations'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(14 inline comments)

Mostly awesome work, Daryl. See my inline comments for a few things."}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Renamed directory structure based on final project name and cleaned up directory structure. Also cleared up nearly all pep8 issues.'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I'm assuming you mean to condense the servers, images, and flavors into a single compute service? (I also saw the mail on the message list this morning so the rename makes sense) Keeping them broken up seems to make sense from an organizational standpoint, especially as we start adding extensions (which I was planning to add as its own service)"}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I'm on board with what blamer suggests. I think at this point we agree on the basic structure of what we have here. The details can be hammered out after this first push. My team also has a large backlog of tests that I'd like to start making other merge props on, but I didn't want to add them to this patch"}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (14 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/openstack-integration-tests-merge/21/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

great stuff, Daryl'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me, approved

sending through...'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Made modifications based on comments from Jay. Also fixed additional pep8 issues. The only section of code not passing pep8 is the kong dir structure, which will be deprecated shortly. I can fix those if needed also.'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Nice, can't wait to get this in. 

1) Needs to pass PEP8. ($ pep8 nova/)

2) I have some issues normally about relative imports, but they seem to work well here. However, IMO common/ should be in the nova directory so that we're always importing from "nova.*"

3) Some of the names are slightly redundant: nova.services.nova.json.images_json_client.py might just be nova.clients.nova.json.images.py

4) I guess we'll remove the kong/ directory and make sure that we're testing all of the same functionality? I'm guessing it's going to go away at some point so we're just writing tests one way.'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Can you provide comments for each update, so that everyone knows what the different Patch Sets are addressing? Also, did we decide on a name (storm) in the tests meeting last week?'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I'm mostly with you on the changes Waldon, but I'd love to get this in and then make some of the changes after it's in. It would be easier to get everything working with a bunch of smaller changes than wait until this particular proposal is perfect. Thoughts?

Daryl: I'd like to see a working default config file in etc/, and ideally it would have an "ini" or "conf" extension instead of a "config" extension (purely for VIM highlighting rules to kick in).

However, all of that being said, I think we should get this in today and then we can iron out the issues.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I haven't gotten very deep into the code yet, but I would like to suggest the following directory structure in place of what is proposed here. The example directories assume the project is called 'storm':

/setup.py                                    # This is used to create our distribution packages and to interact with pip
/bin/storm                                    # This is a test runner that can easily be installed and run through pip
/etc/config.ini                             # This is to configure the test environment, ship with config.ini.example
/tests/                                        # Tests that verify our common code works as expected
/storm/common/                         # Modules such as rest_client.py and ssh.py belong here
/storm/common/__init__.py       # data_utils goes in here
/storm/tests/                               # This is a flat directory of tests. Consider it the meat of the suite
/storm/services/                         # Modules such as compute.py and identity.py go in here. All these
                                                  #    do is talk to public APIs. This is a flat directory as well"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Can we condense the services package down a bit? I think it would be a lot cleaner if we combined everything under storm/services/nova/ into storm/service/nova.py. And we should absolutely rename it to compute, since we're coding to a spec, not the implementation."}, {'account_id': 1731, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

No images and servers client in storm/services/nova/json/.
See storm/openstack.py'}, {'account_id': 1850, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(3 inline comments)

GJ!
I made comment on code.
And also, I think pep8 work is needed too.'}, {'account_id': 1850, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (4 inline comments)

It looks not all pep8 error fixed.'}, {'account_id': 1850, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

GJ! Joe'}, {'account_id': 1850, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1073, 'date': '2011-11-13 12:26:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

We also need to decide on the config file and it's location. The Zodiac merge needs it in /etc/storm.conf, which isn't merged. Some of the flexibility from Kong's etc/config.ini could be merged with Zodiac's config file for the tests to run, and have etc/storm.conf. 
Eg. * add the authentication flag 
    * remove zodiac's auth_url flag for nova and keep host, port, api_ver from the original config.ini
    * add the tenant_name, create_image_enabled and resize_available flags"}]

commit_message:
Initial import of tests from the Zodiac project. On suggestion from Westmaas, imported tests under the nova directory
(final naming TBD) to more quickly get them imported. To run these tests, execute 'nosetests nova/tests'.
I've also only submitted the most stable of the tests. More to come.

Change-Id: I2abd961992c02b27c4deaa9f11a49ba91c5b765d

Fixed config defaults

Change-Id: I90d5ea20167caddbec6b4cf51a0df9bb333514cb

commit_message:
Bug #887805 Error during report_driver_status(): 'LibvirtConnection' object has no attribute '_host_state'

Fixes the host status reports from LibvirtConnection driver.
This fix initializes in class 'LibvirtConnection', the local variable
'_host_state' and replaces the variable 'session' by the local
variable 'read_only'.

Change-Id: Ia3ba29dc287c793c79a2bbde0d5ec69eb6ada480

commit_message:
Verify security group parameters

Introduced various sanity checks before adding security group rule
into the database. The checks have been implemented both in EC2 and
openstack extension code.
Implemented the suggestions made in first patch by Brian
Fixed the unit tests in security groups
Fixed pep8 issues in security group unit tests

Fixes bug 869979.

Change-Id: I2ac28666e90e7bdeacb7b1c2676c0719cfb9e441

[{'created': '2011-11-01 19:32:25.000000000', 'message': "Stop nova-ajax-console-proxy configuring its own logging.

nova-ajax-console-proxy is overriding the logging configuration carefully
set up by nova.log.  There's no reason for it to do this, and it's the only
script in nova/bin that does.  I've removed that code.

Change-Id: I5b2d5026d529a20d26ba3bb721b15f235f6fdda8
"}]
commit_message:
Stop nova-ajax-console-proxy configuring its own logging.

nova-ajax-console-proxy is overriding the logging configuration carefully
set up by nova.log.  There's no reason for it to do this, and it's the only
script in nova/bin that does.  I've removed that code.

Change-Id: I5b2d5026d529a20d26ba3bb721b15f235f6fdda8

subject: Bug #888730: vmwareapi suds debug logging very verbose
messages:
[{'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-10 20:35:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2011-11-10 20:42:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Is there a reason why the following wouldn't work?

diff --git a/nova/log.py b/nova/log.py
index 0f2153a..14e11c8 100644
--- a/nova/log.py
+++ b/nova/log.py
@@ -64,6 +64,7 @@ flags.DEFINE_list('default_log_levels',
                   ['amqplib=WARN',
                    'sqlalchemy=WARN',
                    'boto=WARN',
+                   'suds=WARN',
                    'eventlet.wsgi.server=WARN'],
                   'list of logger=LEVEL pairs')

(or suds=INFO)
Seems like a saner change then creating a separate flag."}, {'account_id': 271, 'date': '2011-11-10 20:48:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorry, was not aware of default_log_levels.  Will resubmit.'}, {'account_id': 271, 'date': '2011-11-10 21:53:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-10 21:59:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Rebased, since the Gerrit God was angry.  No change to the patchset.  Looks like it needs reapproving.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-11 19:50:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-10 20:30:19.000000000', 'message': "Bug #888730: vmwareapi suds debug logging very verbose

Add a flag specifically to control the log level on the suds library.
This means that it's possible to turn the application to DEBUG level
generally, without turning on DEBUG for suds (suds logs very verbosely at
DEBUG level, severely affecting performance).

Original code: Sateesh Chodapuneedi <sateesh.chodapuneedi@citrix.com>

Change-Id: I4a1b09470aeba006112734fae9feef3d228eaced
"}, {'created': '2011-11-10 21:53:09.000000000', 'message': 'Bug #888730: vmwareapi suds debug logging very verbose

Set suds log level to INFO by default, using
default_log_levels.

Change-Id: I4a1b09470aeba006112734fae9feef3d228eaced
'}, {'created': '2011-11-11 19:48:46.000000000', 'message': 'Bug #888730: vmwareapi suds debug logging very verbose

Set suds log level to INFO by default, using
default_log_levels.

Change-Id: I4a1b09470aeba006112734fae9feef3d228eaced
'}]
commit_message:
Bug #888730: vmwareapi suds debug logging very verbose

Set suds log level to INFO by default, using
default_log_levels.

Change-Id: I4a1b09470aeba006112734fae9feef3d228eaced

commit_message:
Fix a notification bug when creating instances

Fixes a notifier bug that caused 'launched_at' to be empty and
state to be reported as 'building', due to failure to refresh
instance data prior to generating the notification.  Fixes
bug 834867.

Change-Id: I70fbf3c67407c67b69040ee481ca6d51212cc55d

Looks good as far as I can tell... although you'll have a ton of conflicts now with Johannes's branch that merged (the fault changes)."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-28 14:24:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

lgtm, but I smell merge hell..'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-28 15:10:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-28 15:10:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Yep, quite a painful merge...'}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2011-10-31 20:29:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Dietz: My reasoning was that xml serialization is only useful to the wsgi layer anyways, and there were a few of circular dependencies between the two already. I also put it there for simplicity while we're working on the admin api split."}, {'account_id': 518, 'date': '2011-11-10 13:14:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Restructuring OSAPI code for Admin API endpoint

Move existing v1.1 code into nova.api.openstack.v1 and move some
admin-only coutrollers into nova.api.openstack.admin. Some common code had
to be restructured temporarily and will be relocated permanently in a
future commit. This begins to implement blueprint separate-nova-adminapi

Change-Id: Id487fcb1a98cbff762c5023631ab1b51d31a11f9

There's also a ton of cleanup going on here.

commit_message:
Download caching, dependency cleanup, run_tests improvements.

Fixed bug 888813 -- removed duplicate installations of glance as
a dependency in buildout. Set a required version for pycrypto
as a dependency since older versions will fail, but 2.4 can't be
installed by buildout. Turned on download caching for pip and
buildout in run_tests.sh. Turned on mirroring for pip, just
in case.

Made the output from run_tests.sh commands a little more helpful.
Made sure that commands like --pep8 and --pylint don't stop
partway through due to bad exit codes.

Change-Id: Ie7f645707741b86908029ea1821fe2129004c0b3

commit_message:
Capture exceptions happening in API layer

Added the faulwrapper around EC2 api so that it captures any unseen
exceptions and return a graceful error back. Also changed the openstack
exception message. The actual exception message will be printed in the
logs and would not return back the user.
Removed openstack wsgi dependency from
EC2 fault wrapper. Added unit tests for
EC2 fault wrapper
Fixes bug 869132.

Change-Id: I03d18f321f141ae96f1add99ea0b70e736253c89

messages:
[{'account_id': 1528, 'date': '2011-11-10 11:44:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Will be helpful.

Although I wonder if it's ok that _register itself exits. I'd rather see the main functions calling sys.exit and internal ones (_register) returning error codes. Maybe it can be even refactored to make fn(*fn_args, **fn_kwargs) check the return value of main functions and sys.exit(result) when it's not None / 0 ? But I won't insist on changing it that way :)"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-11-10 14:27:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I absolutely agree with you, Stanislaw, but unfortunately the precedent in the file is to sys.exit() from wherever it is most convenient. For that reason, I'm fine with this patch."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-10 16:41:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 271, 'date': '2011-11-10 20:13:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-10 20:22:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I can't see any differences between this one and the previous patch set..."}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-11-10 20:57:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 271, 'date': '2011-11-10 22:03:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Second submission was an accident, sorry about that.  There's no change there (other than a rebase).

Yes, it might be cleaner if we called sys.exit from near the top level, and let exceptions propagate up, but I was following the existing style in this file, which is to do the sys.exits near the failure."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2011-11-10 23:01:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks good'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-11-10 23:04:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, approved

commit_message:
Gracefully handle image_cache_dir being undefined

This abstracts out the 'set_paths' method of our two cache drivers into the
base driver for now. It raises an exception when image_cache_dir is not
defined. Fixes bug 888340

Change-Id: Ib0be8c9b29ba1efebd03a0cdb8d001a003fc236f

commit_message:
Removing assertGreaterEqual

Python 2.6 doesn't support this, so we should use assertTrue
instead. Fixes bug 888711

Change-Id: I78a0603bc4979ae3831394ea57f12fd328e03573

commit_message:
Use TENANT_ID instead of TENANT for project_id

Updated to also add ID/Name and still do X-Tenant for compatibility.

Added middleware documentation for HTTP and headers.

Change-Id: Ia35dd1d1041a8a9f14e4f54e2483d3af9c847904
Cc: stable-maintainers

subject: Fixing volumes pep8 issues.
messages:
[{'account_id': 6, 'date': '2011-11-02 18:08:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not submit

this won't pass gerrit - it's a secondary change with a dependency on the first instead of a single amended change. (I can hear you cursing this process now).

Rebase the two changes together, and then do a  "git --amend" and change the Change-Id: to:

Change-Id: I908c7457e47ba7da3d3df37679298ed98ce097b0

And redo the "git review" command - that will submit it as an updated patch set to Gerrit, which will work. Once that's done, abandon this change.'}, {'account_id': 543, 'date': '2011-11-10 18:58:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

me learning gerrit'}]

subject: Fixing Cisco plugin after update_* change
messages:
[{'account_id': 233, 'date': '2011-11-10 18:38:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

when I apply this patch and use run_tests.sh it doesn't run any tests.. does it work for you? This is a completely clean environment with no packages installed."}, {'account_id': 1549, 'date': '2011-11-10 18:38:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It works for me, no problem.  Both Quantum tests and Cisco tests (after setting PLUGIN_DIR).  It doesn't run any tests at all?

I'll make sure to test it on some different environments and see if I can recreate it."}, {'account_id': 1549, 'date': '2011-11-10 18:38:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1456, 'date': '2011-11-10 18:38:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm not a huge fan of the logging within each test, it dirties the tests themselves. Is that not supplied by the test runner? For that matter I'm also not a fan of the comments duplicating the test name, if the description of the test is too long to fit in the name of the test, the test is specing to much."}, {'account_id': 1549, 'date': '2011-11-10 18:38:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1549, 'date': '2011-11-10 18:38:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Added a blank line for PEP8.'}, {'account_id': 233, 'date': '2011-11-10 18:38:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

On my oneiric machine (python 2.7.2) no tests run, but on natty (python 2.7.1) it seems to run all the tests.  Must be a version mismatch of something.. oh well.'}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2011-11-10 18:38:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, approved

We are still seeing some issues in some of our environments (as reported by Shweta), but we will go ahead with this for now.'}, {'account_id': 704, 'date': '2011-11-10 18:38:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1549, 'date': '2011-11-10 18:38:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1549, 'date': '2011-11-10 18:38:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I'll let the plugin developers take care of cleaning up their tests.  I just want to get it stable right now."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-10 18:38:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/quantum-pep8/55/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/quantum/81/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-10 18:38:22.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Add more error handling to glance xenapi plugin

Also add some extra logging to help track down problems that occur
when getting images from glance.

Change-Id: I2246d06364211ae377c7a89f93a76f339a201a8d

commit_message:
Add a new swift auth middleware.

- This is based on the same other swift middleware like tempauth/swauth.
- It handle ACL mapping roles to swift groups.
- Container sync.

Future:

- let validation by auth_token.
- s3 compatibility.

Change-Id: I5c1f21dfde7b2c77de62a6c77438c56c4288c370

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-09 22:54:13.000000000', 'message': 'Allow glance-cache-* find their config files

By default, glance-cache-cleaner looks for glance-cleaner.conf but
its actual config file is glance-cache.conf.

Change the find_config_file() argument to conf_name and make it an
optional argument to load_paste_app(). This allows us to specify
a different config file for the glance apps than their app name.

find_config_file() is also changed to raise an exception if no
config file is found.

Change-Id: Iec71218f5b2f0a7f057ea02f4549bd743892cc65
'}]
commit_message:
Allow glance-cache-* find their config files

By default, glance-cache-cleaner looks for glance-cleaner.conf but
its actual config file is glance-cache.conf.

Change the find_config_file() argument to conf_name and make it an
optional argument to load_paste_app(). This allows us to specify
a different config file for the glance apps than their app name.

find_config_file() is also changed to raise an exception if no
config file is found.

Change-Id: Iec71218f5b2f0a7f057ea02f4549bd743892cc65

commit_message:
blueprint: improve-user-experience
Bug #884453
Ensured branding is contained and can't escape sidebar space/break layout by adding
a CSS style #main_nav h1. This bounds the branding area and disables overflow.
Additionally padding ot the right is adjuested moving the topbar navigation in line
with the sidebars righthand side for asthetics.

Change-Id: Id0fcb71d8823e997fa891975dc9f1af904f862d1

commit_message:
Use TENANT_ID if it exists, but still support X_TENANT.

This continues support for middleware that is using the older data model where tenantId and tenantName were the same thing. X_TENANT is what is in the URL in Keystoe.

Added documentation on Middleware headers and HTTP API interactions.

Change-Id: I65a31ab07eb18d6882977acc64679c873b951bfb

Use TENANT_ID if it exists, but still support X_TENANT.

This continues support for middleware that is using the older data model where tenantId and tenantName were the same thing. X_TENANT is what is in the URL in Keystoe.

Added documentation on Middleware headers and HTTP API interactions.

commit_message:
Fixes for using keystone in VPC:
    1) Create DB file with keystone as owner, fixing a permissions issue
    2) Added %tenant_id% to the keystone-nova service endpoint

Change-Id: Ia1a237bdaaec16b34a98b199eca41e4801e1fbd8

commit_message:
Replace libvirt driver's use of libxml2 with ElementTree

libxml2 has been rather awkward as a dependency, and ElementTree
is in the standard library, so this replaces all use of libxml2 with
ElementTree instead.

Change-Id: Ib99983d5b04cc9f899584bfd4335fa9f7ece3c40

commit_message:
Extend fake image service to let it hold image data

Make the fake image service able to store image data in memory. This is
handy for unit testing, but probably not very useful otherwise (images
are pretty big, so holding them in memory is not a very good idea).

Change-Id: I2d07baf24cab544e19521b9486feee3272d0407e

commit_message:
Verify security group parameters

    Introduced various sanity checks before adding security group rule
    into the database. The checks have been implemented both in EC2 and
    openstack extension code.
    Implemented the suggestions made in first patch by Brian
    Fixes bug 869979.

    Change-Id: I2ac28666e90e7bdeacb7b1c2676c0719cfb9e441

Change-Id: I24bd52500b7c0f4972bfc292000bae9b67bea6e5

subject: Fix exception reraising in volume manager.
messages:
[{'account_id': 100, 'date': '2011-10-27 13:59:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(2 inline comments)

Take a look at the inline comments, but the short of it is, this might be better fixed using utils.original_exception_raised."}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2011-10-27 14:14:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2011-10-27 14:20:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2011-10-27 14:24:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

No updates to use util.original_exception_raised?

You can see similar code in nova/compute/manager.py:_run_instance"}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2011-10-27 14:25:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

See my reply on this inline at Patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2011-10-27 14:42:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2011-10-27 14:49:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2011-10-27 15:49:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2011-10-28 09:33:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-10-29 05:08:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

See comment in Patch set 1.  Johannes is correct.   We have the context manager to cover the exact case you're trying to solve."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2011-10-31 15:59:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I understand Yuriy's concern over utils.original_exception_raised() that it changes the behavior from dropping the original exception to dropping the new exception.

I've submitted a patch to fix that behavior to log the original exception if a new exception occurs. This should be closer to standard python behavior but also handles the case of the exception context being cleared that original_exception_raised was intended to fix.

https://review.openstack.org/1213"}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2011-11-03 17:39:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The changes to util.original_exception_raised have been merged. It's now called utils.save_and_reraise_exception and will favor new exceptions over the original, but will log the original if it is dropped.

I think this is what you are looking for."}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2011-11-08 14:23:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2011-11-08 14:27:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks, Johannes.
Switched to save_and_reraise_exception usage'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2011-11-08 14:34:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks good!'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-11-08 22:57:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I'm still trying to get used to using context managers to do this type of thing. This is what we've been doing other places, so this works for me. Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 209, 'date': '2011-11-09 20:08:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-09 20:30:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Build Unstable 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova/121849/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-merge/335/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-pep8/1708/ : UNSTABLE"}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2011-11-09 23:40:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2011-11-10 02:47:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-11-10 03:39:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-11-10 06:02:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-10 06:10:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

commit_message:
Undefine libvirt saved instances

Fixes bug 814561

Adding a call to managedSaveRemove if the instance has a
saved instance, so they are now undefined in addition to running
instances during destroy
With test case

Also added myself to Authors

Change-Id: If93e8ac6972116152f38e187bd1a61c652855814

commit_message:
Get MAC addresses from Melange.

Add support for obtaining MAC addresses for VIFs from Melange.  Adds the
--use_melange_mac_generation flag to enable this support.

Change-Id: I00b3622531f244bf5f15910752a1e444b821e91a

commit_message:
Added sanity checks and environment versioning to run_tests.sh.

Implements blueprint environment-versioning.

Fixed bug 887885. The script will bail if the seleniumrc or test scripts are missing, preventing the hang, or the possibility of bad environments.

Change-Id: I3cdeb71660c897e8b2adbf81d3794333d1847204

commit_message:
Fix for bug 877525

We now have a verbose flag (-v) for run_tests.sh if you want ot see all that
crap printed to the screen.  The default behavior is just to print "test nam
.. OK".  Also, we took the code from nova to cat run_tests.log if there is a
error so that if we hit an import error we will see it in the console jenkin
output.

Change-Id: Id8997c658a61691bf9f25b1c01e6a5db0eca428f
