[{'account_id': 741, 'date': '2011-11-04 20:01:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

Tested as working correctly. Both auto and manually assigned floating IPs now work correctly.'}, {'account_id': 741, 'date': '2011-11-04 20:08:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Also, https://review.openstack.org/628 includes these fixes, among others, for the master branch.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-11-08 15:31:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok, it took me a while to figure out what's going on here, but here's the story:

* This is all specific to auto_assign_floating_ip=true, which is False by default. This was a new feature in Diablo (https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/floating-ip-auto-assignment) and it looks like it never actually worked since this bug appears to have been there from the beginning.
* Trey's change on master (https://review.openstack.org/#change,628) is a substantial re-factoring which moves code from the network API stubs into the network manager
* As a side-effect, Trey fixed an issue (#834633) where a FloatingIp object was passed to network_api.associate_floating_ip() instead of an address string
* In #834633, Serguei Koubli had previously (i.e. before Trey's refactoring) proposed a much more isolated fix for this issue
* Kiall has taken Serguei's original fix, but also fixed a separate issue with disassociating auto assigned IPs. This too appears to have been fixed during Trey's refactoring"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-11-08 15:39:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Kiall, you need to add yourself to the Authors file in order for the tests to pass

Other than that, lgtm

I'd like to see Trey review this though"}, {'account_id': 741, 'date': '2011-11-08 15:46:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 741, 'date': '2011-11-08 15:46:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Fixes bug 834633 - Auto assigning floating IPs

Details:

 - This fix is specific to the auto_assign_floating_ip=true feature, which was new in diablo[1] and looks like it never actually worked.
 - Trey's refactoring on master[2] fixed bug #834633 where a FloatingIp object was passed to network_api.associate_floating_ip() instead of an address string.
 - In bug #834633, Serguei Koubli had previously (i.e. before Trey's refactoring) proposed a much more isolated fix for this issue.
 - This commit includes Serguei Koubli's fix, and, has also fixed a seperate issue where auto-assigned flating IPs could not be deallocated. (This fix was also included in Trey's refactoring)

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/floating-ip-auto-assignment
[2] https://review.openstack.org/628

Change-Id: Ie439c6743f066f8504ef88de861dee8a7762940d

commit_message:
Remove unused versions pipeline from PasteDeploy config

Since the version negotiation middleware was introduced, versions
pipeline app in the config is unused. Consequently, the versions
app factory is unused too.

Change-Id: I2d50432de215e51c1e52f8d68eaa0820e9b5bd0b

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-09 17:35:55.000000000', 'message': 'Follow hostname RFCs / Remove hostname storage

Currently when a server is created, a hostname is generated from
the 'display_name'. If the 'display_name' is not present, a hostname
will be generated looking like "Server XXXX" where XXXX is the ID.

Storing the hostname in the database is redundant, as display_name
is already stored. This patch removes the 'hostname' column and
simply passes the entire instance down to the virt layer so that it
can decide what to set the hostname to for an instance.

Also, hostname sanitization should now more closely follow RFC-952
and RFC-1123.

Fixes bug 885374

Change-Id: I0a0c474b0cc30708529a08712f468a1e3a4ea796
'}]
commit_message:
Follow hostname RFCs / Remove hostname storage

Currently when a server is created, a hostname is generated from
the 'display_name'. If the 'display_name' is not present, a hostname
will be generated looking like "Server XXXX" where XXXX is the ID.

Storing the hostname in the database is redundant, as display_name
is already stored. This patch removes the 'hostname' column and
simply passes the entire instance down to the virt layer so that it
can decide what to set the hostname to for an instance.

Also, hostname sanitization should now more closely follow RFC-952
and RFC-1123.

Fixes bug 885374

Change-Id: I0a0c474b0cc30708529a08712f468a1e3a4ea796

Apply M2Crypto fix for all Fedora-based distributions.

Broaden Fedora check to include RHEL and others.

Fixes bug 884885

Change-Id: Ifab330a7f866add91d01c8cf2470e5a12fb4cd4d

subject: Workaround for eventlet bug with unit tests in RHEL6.1.
messages:
[{'account_id': 321, 'date': '2011-11-09 02:26:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2011-11-09 02:28:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2011-11-09 03:08:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I don't think patching files installed and managed by rpm is a good idea. There is nothing to prevent it from being overwritten since its not marked as a config file in the spec.

I believe we should be monkey patching it instead and file a bug with EPEL to fix their package."}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2011-11-09 03:16:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The header on the patch file is misleading, the actual file being patched is the one installed by pip inside the virtualenv: 

.nova-venv/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eventlet/green/subprocess.py'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2011-11-09 03:25:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Ah, much better, sorry I missed that. Is Bueno!'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-11-09 06:36:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Uggh, what a trainwreck. Not sure which I blame more - eventlet monkey patching the hell out of everything or new APIs backported into RHEL

Hopefully we can get the eventlet fix in upstream. I've asked the Python package maintainer who backported the timeout API to try and help push the eventlet fix along. If it gets in, we can just revert this workaround

Looks like this is going to conflict with the fix for #884885 - so either rebase onto it and make this change a dependency of it, or just wait until it goes in and rebase

Apart from that, mostly lgtm apart from a few things I'll comment on inline"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-11-09 06:40:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (2 inline comments)

commit_message:
Workaround for eventlet bug with unit tests in RHEL6.1.

This adds a patch to fix the broken eventlet code that's installed in the
virtualenv.

Fixes bug 884915

Change-Id: I6dbf755abbc5a52208de3dd892257ce39686d396

subject: Revised curl examples (bug 884789)
messages:
[{'account_id': 8, 'date': '2011-11-09 00:34:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(1 inline comment)

Explanation for getTenants call for admin and service api need to change."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-11-09 15:53:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-11-09 16:05:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-11-09 16:08:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Yogi: Other than which tokens GET /tenants lists tenants for, I'm not sure what other differences you're referring to which would fall inside the scope of this document? If there's something specific you're referring to that would impact how the curl request is formed or how the response is structured, please point it out.

It might be worthwhile to maintain a Service vs Admin Implementation Comparison document, to cover subtle behavioral differences in more rigorous detail."}, {'account_id': 8, 'date': '2011-11-09 17:27:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

This is what I see as decription

List the tenants your admin token has access to::

This is misleading.The ListTennants call for the admin API is going to list all the tenants in the system.
That does not mean that you have access on those tenants.

One cannot use admin token and get a token for each of these tenants.

The listTenants call on the serviceapi 
is the one on that gives list of tenants on which you have access.
One could use his token and get a token for each of these tenants."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-11-09 17:50:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8, 'date': '2011-11-09 17:51:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-11-09 17:52:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks, I wouldn't have thought to describe it as a different action with a different goal."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-11-09 18:14:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-09 18:15:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

commit_message:
Track post-Diablo database evolution using migrations (BP: database-migrations)

- Added SQLAlchemy Migrations as a dependency (pip install sqlalchemy-migrate)
- Added empty migration repo
- Made migration manage.py executable
- Added initial migration matching diablo-tagged release
- Added usage docs for contributors
- Added doc that explains how to migrate.

Change-Id: I4fa8f930645ac6b7f82d0472361fe114b71bb489

subject: Make the openvswitch plugin tests work again
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-09 16:39:24.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 233, 'date': '2011-11-09 16:39:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-09 16:39:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/quantum-pep8/52/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/quantum/78/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 233, 'date': '2011-11-09 16:39:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 233, 'date': '2011-11-09 16:39:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I think you'll like this one better.. it works now but it's still not perfect (it runs the plugin-specific tests twice)."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2011-11-09 16:39:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I think that the answer is that when you use PLUGIN_DIR you run a different run_tests.py. 

It seems that with packaging changes we updated the run_tests for 'general' tests, but not the one for plugin-specific tests. I've copied over the file in common/lib/quantum and sorted out import issues, but still having troubles"}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2011-11-09 16:39:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

I think the issue is the one I highlighted in the in-line comments. I can now run all the tests, altough they still fail for issues related to my development enviroment (access denied to mysql server)'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2011-11-09 16:39:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Dan, it looks like you have the same problem I had yesterday with the distribute package (see netstack ML)'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2011-11-09 16:39:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not submit

(4 inline comments)

Most of my code comments are just nits, but my main issue is that when I run it with the OVS plugin, it doesn't seem to work.  It is supposed to run all 200+ tests with the OVS plugin loaded instead of the Sample Plugin, but instead it just runs extra tests that only the OVS plugin defines.  

Am I doing something wrong?  


PLUGIN_DIR=plugins/openvswitch-plugin/lib/quantum/plugins/openvswitch/ ./run_tests.sh -N
FunctionTestCase
    runTest                                                     OK
VlanMapTest
    testAddVlan                                                 OK
    testReleaseVlan                                             OK

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 3 tests in 0.002s"}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2011-11-09 16:39:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

btw, I upgraded to distribute 0.6.24 and still see the same behavior.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2011-11-09 16:39:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Something still doesn't seem quite right.  It only runs 98 tests when PLUGIN_DIR is specified, whereas the full test suite without specifying PLUGIN_DIR is 233 tests."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2011-11-09 16:39:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, approved

Ok, Brad helped clear this up.  It is really just a difference in how tests are reported by the two different run_tests.py files.  The main run_tests.py reports all 233 in one batch, while the one in OVS reports them in two chunks, server (135) and client (98).  Since the tests output is very verbose (something else we should fix...), I only saw the 98 at the end.

It would be nice to fix the OVS run_tests.py to match the main one, but that is not urgent for the release.    

Given that Somik already +1'd this patch as well, I will +2 it."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2011-11-09 16:39:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Salvatore.  Can you explain how setting or not setting PLUGIN_DIR affects this?  On the same machine, presumably with the same version of distribute, I get all 233 tests when I run: 

./run_tests.sh -N

but I get only 98 tests when running: 

PLUGIN_DIR=plugins/openvswitch-plugin/lib/quantum/plugins/openvswitch/ ./run_tests.sh -N

I was under the impression from your mail that the only determinant of whether one got all of a limited set of tests was the version of distribute running.  

Btw, my machine is natty and runs distribute 0.6.15, yet I seem to get all 233 unit tests, which I found odd.'}, {'account_id': 452, 'date': '2011-11-09 16:39:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Couple of files have no changes otherwise looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2011-11-09 16:39:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

hey sorry Salvatore, I didn't see that you had outstanding comments on the code itself, otherwise I wouldn't have +2'd the patch.  Brad is planning on submitting another clean-up patch for this later today as well, so he should be able to address your concerns in that patch."}]

commit_message:
Remove nova dependency on vconfig on Linux.

iproute2 is already a dependency and is used everywhere and is more
capable than vconfig. This commit just replaces all uses of vconfig.

Change-Id: I5860a10f151a176bf9849feda6052d4c2b491e07

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-09 06:28:42.000000000', 'message': 'Bug #875995: Quantum README fixes

Fix the most obvious issues with the Quantum README and add pointers to
external documentation resources.

In a future commit, we plan to remove most of the content in the README
and leave it just as references to external documentation.  However,
this change requires us to be able to support multiple version of our
external documentation (not yet possible) and have a good location for
developer documentation.

Change-Id: I57d7f99f070d17564b7a5fdcef8ae8ad2a6575a6
'}]
commit_message:
Bug #875995: Quantum README fixes

Fix the most obvious issues with the Quantum README and add pointers to
external documentation resources.

In a future commit, we plan to remove most of the content in the README
and leave it just as references to external documentation.  However,
this change requires us to be able to support multiple version of our
external documentation (not yet possible) and have a good location for
developer documentation.

Change-Id: I57d7f99f070d17564b7a5fdcef8ae8ad2a6575a6

commit_message:
Define faults.Fault.__str__.

Define faults.Fault.__str__ to pass through to the wrapped exception.
This is useful for log messages.

Change-Id: Ie566fb67fc6bd29c2ef3b3aefd263507d48e8cfc

Adds selenium to buildout script and uses django-nose-selenium to integrate with Django's unit test machinery. Includes proof-of-implementation tests with both selenium and qunit.

commit_message:
Adds selenium and qunit integration into Django test suite.

Implements blueprint frontend-testing.
Implements blueprint javascript-unit-tests.

Adds selenium to buildout script and uses django-nose-selenium to integrate with Django's unit test machinery. Includes proof-of-implementation tests with both selenium and qunit.

Change-Id: Ic7db4994be398c633a78dca7369359602c7d8f57

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-09 00:57:00.000000000', 'message': 'Swich over to update_{net,port} instead of rename_net and set_port_state

This commit changes the plugin interface so that we have update() functions
that can upate any attributes of the port or network.  In the future when we
add more things like operational state this will give us the flexibility to be
able to update those.  This also allows data extensions to be passed into the
update calls.

Thanks to Tyler and the others at cisco for making the changes to the cisco
plugins and tests (their patch is included in this commit).

Change-Id: If8a0111a7174d94d9f0aed9630e326d428ef994a

commit_message:
Swich over to update_{net,port} instead of rename_net and set_port_state

This commit changes the plugin interface so that we have update() functions
that can upate any attributes of the port or network.  In the future when we
add more things like operational state this will give us the flexibility to be
able to update those.  This also allows data extensions to be passed into the
update calls.

Thanks to Tyler and the others at cisco for making the changes to the cisco
plugins and tests (their patch is included in this commit).

Change-Id: If8a0111a7174d94d9f0aed9630e326d428ef994a

commit_message:
Skip libvirt tests when libvirt not present.

Currently the libvirt tests don't make use of the test.skip_if decorator.
This should make it more obvious when the tests are not getting run.

We recently ran into an issue where libvirt tests were 'passing' in Jenkins
but they were actually not getting run, this should make things more clear.

Change-Id: Ied18d2403fc9accd6c6f739b08c9fe7cc3624bb2

commit_message:
Four modest bug fixes.

Sorry these are in one commit, but they all ran one into the other when I discovered them.

Fixed 887770 -- corrects an instance of "dash" -> "nova" renaming that was missed in openstack-dashboard/dashboard/views.py
Fixed 887768 -- removes duplicate code and adds docstrings to auth_views.py. These changes were previously made but somehow didn't get staged and committed.
Fixed 887767 -- the list of tenants in the tenant switcher no longer changes when viewing the Tenants or Users syspanel pages.
Fixed 887766 -- corrects a broken bit of if/else logic so that the tenant switch list isn't empty.

Change-Id: I0cb6fff83d7279b17233c50ef2d4af2586cca829

(1 inline comment)

Looks like good work.  I should have commented on the "except:" clause when I was looking over your shoulder yesterday, though; fix that up and I think you'll be fine.'}, {'account_id': 1456, 'date': '2011-11-03 21:43:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-03 21:44:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Excellent!'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-11-04 03:37:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

This absolutely solves the issue, but as my inline comment says, I'd like to try and add more, more specific try/except blocks instead of widening the net to contain a lot of lines where a lot could go wrong."}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2011-11-04 15:16:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

The change is great, but I agree with Lamar: the scope of the try/except blocks should be narrowed for the purposes of better logging, with more trys instead. Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 1456, 'date': '2011-11-04 15:20:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

We can still catch specific exceptions within this block; but having unexpected exceptions raise out of this, and not clean up after the spawning process, will leave a mess. If we move the instance to the error state, and log the error, then someone can come in and investigate the problem. Leaving instances in BUILD state forever seems to me like a bad idea.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-04 15:24:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Perhaps the solution is to preserve the smaller try/except blocks, then wrap the whole thing in a single try/except that simply ensures the instance goes into the error state and reraises whatever exception triggered it?'}, {'account_id': 1456, 'date': '2011-11-04 19:07:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-04 19:23:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-11-07 20:13:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

Inline comment, sorry for my confusion but I removed the _logging_error method and corresponding 'with' statements and all of the tests still pass so I'm hoping to learn more about what the contextlib.contextmanager is actually doing here."}, {'account_id': 1456, 'date': '2011-11-07 20:18:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-07 20:25:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

That was an errant spacing change, I blame PyCharm.'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-11-07 23:40:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Ok, so regardless of my confusion around 'yield' generating exceptions... if I remove all of the code changes in compute manager and run the tests they still pass. Shouldn't the tests fail?"}, {'account_id': 1456, 'date': '2011-11-07 23:53:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

The test_instance_set_to_error_on_uncaught_exception fails on my machine without the new exception wrapper. commit_message:
Move failed instances to error state

On instance creation there is the possibility of
an instance raising. This would not cause the
instance to be moved to the error state. This
patch fixes that. lp885323

update 1: fixing exception handling
update 2: preserving the individual messages
update 3: rebase on master & fix spacing

Change-Id: I7584b527e408c08014f1b6a8abda343f1e2aa3b8

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-10-18 05:09:15.000000000', 'message': 'Add DHCP support to the QuantumManager and break apart dhcp/gateway

This introduces a new flag "quantum_use_dhcp=<boolean>" which indicates whether
or not to enable dhcp for all of the networks.  If it is set then we start
dnsmasq (and provide it with the IP/MACs from Melange) similar to how this was
done in linux_net before.

Prior to this if you enabled dhcp then you would also get a gateway device..
some people may not want that so we now require that you specify the gateway
when creating the network in order to end up with a device that will act as a
gateway.  If you're using Melange IPAM and you don't specify the gateway you
still end up with one because it doesn't allow you to not have one.  This lays
the groundwork for the option of not having one in the future, at least :)

Change-Id: I6a84da35237b6c5f5cdee91ada92642103439a97
'}, {'created': '2011-10-20 06:12:58.000000000', 'message': 'Add DHCP support to the QuantumManager and break apart dhcp/gateway

This introduces a new flag "quantum_use_dhcp=<boolean>" which indicates whether
or not to enable dhcp for all of the networks.  If it is set then we start
dnsmasq (and provide it with the IP/MACs from Melange) similar to how this was
done in linux_net before.

Prior to this if you enabled dhcp then you would also get a gateway device..
some people may not want that so we now require that you specify the gateway
when creating the network in order to end up with a device that will act as a
gateway.  If you're using Melange IPAM and you don't specify the gateway you
still end up with one because it doesn't allow you to not have one.  This lays
the groundwork for the option of not having one in the future, at least :)

Also, fix quantum/melange ipam interaction

We now query for the subnets by net_id/vif_id instead of searching through all
the blocks to find the right one.  Both of the allocate and deallocate for
instance calls are now using the vif_id -> network_id mapping instead of
searching the quantum networks.  get_port_by_attachment was also changed to
take a net_id so that we don't have to search through all of the quantum
networks to find the corresponding port.

Change-Id: I6a84da35237b6c5f5cdee91ada92642103439a97

commit_message:
Add DHCP support to the QuantumManager and break apart dhcp/gateway

This introduces a new flag "quantum_use_dhcp=<boolean>" which indicates whether
or not to enable dhcp for all of the networks.  If it is set then we start
dnsmasq (and provide it with the IP/MACs from Melange) similar to how this was
done in linux_net before.

Prior to this if you enabled dhcp then you would also get a gateway device..
some people may not want that so we now require that you specify the gateway
when creating the network in order to end up with a device that will act as a
gateway.  If you're using Melange IPAM and you don't specify the gateway you
still end up with one because it doesn't allow you to not have one.  This lays
the groundwork for the option of not having one in the future, at least :)

Also, fix quantum/melange ipam interaction

We now query for the subnets by net_id/vif_id instead of searching through all
the blocks to find the right one.  Both of the allocate and deallocate for
instance calls are now using the vif_id -> network_id mapping instead of
searching the quantum networks.  get_port_by_attachment was also changed to
take a net_id so that we don't have to search through all of the quantum
networks to find the corresponding port.

Change-Id: I6a84da35237b6c5f5cdee91ada92642103439a97

commit_message:
Change network delete to delete by uuid or cidr

With melange it will be possible to have overlapping cidrs so it would be
better to specify the uuid of the network to delete.

Change-Id: I6781225d587952cbab3387cd40164d8ac77c58d6

Looks good.

One question: I notice that all of the prior tests were testing for status codes and content types.  Are we testing the status code generation and the content types separately somewhere?'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2011-11-05 23:42:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Since we talk directly to the controller now, it only returns an object. If there is an error, an exception is raised with the appropriate HTTP status code.

The tests check for either success (and then checks the object) or it checks an appropriate exception is raised.

Separately the XML serialization is tested for given inputs and outputs.

So, Content-Type isn't checked anymore because only objects are returned, and status codes are checked by way of checking the appropriate exception is raised."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2011-11-06 00:10:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Nice.  Thanks for the explanation.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-11-08 22:13:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, approved

commit_message:
Switch glance XenAPI plugin to use urllib2.

Currently the plugin uses httplib which does not handle redirects
natively. XenAPI plugins require Python 2.4+ so using httplib2
as far as I know is not a possibility.

(Patch Set 2) Oops, forgot to PEP8 before putting up for review.
(Patch Set 3) Updated logging to be more verbose as per Waldon

Change-Id: I189093fe26dfee30b5b8b3c0f2c21a35fbfbc05e

"}]
commit_message:
load gettext in __init__ to fix '_ is not defined'

gettext.install needs to be run on every potential entrypoint; this
resolves bug #885529 (the python standard library includes a noop
gettext library for this purpose). This is also how nova does it.

Change-Id: I4ceaa4782461ebf6d27836336f288d79ba15cf2d

Blueprint authentication-for-quantum

Modifies quantum.conf to include authN filter and pipeline with auth (optional)
Removes bufferedhttp.py (not used anymore as middleware stays in keystone's tree)

commit_message:
Optional --no-site-packages in venv

Added a flag to run_tests.sh to allow user to optionally install venv with --no-site-packages.

This fixes bug 880905

[{'created': '2011-11-04 20:48:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes LP Bug#885434 - Documentation showing multiple tenants misleading

While the Keystone API Spec supports multiple tenants, the Keystone
implementation does not. The samples have been simplified to show
only one tenant returned.

Change-Id: I6aecb603cab83a4fb987a2cdaddbd366443615ec
'}, {'created': '2011-11-08 16:34:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes LP Bug#885434 - Documentation showing multiple tenants misleading

Change-Id: I6aecb603cab83a4fb987a2cdaddbd366443615ec
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes LP Bug#885434 - Documentation showing multiple tenants misleading

While the Keystone API Spec supports multiple tenants, the Keystone
implementation does not. The samples have been simplified to show
only one tenant returned.

Change-Id: I6aecb603cab83a4fb987a2cdaddbd366443615ec

I'm not familiar with the refactoring, but I have one inline comment and I guess I have to ask if there are any tests that should be written to catch this in the future?"}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2011-11-08 01:06:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

> any tests that should be written to catch this in the future?

This kind of bug seems like it should be caught by the integration tests (unit-tests may not find it because stubs can mask the issue).

I'd vote we update our integration tests so that we're building instances with --generate-swap enabled."}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2011-11-08 16:30:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

The reason this is hard to test on its own is because it is a procedural mess.

But its a good hotfix so +1'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2011-11-08 16:41:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2011-11-08 16:42:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

subject: Use pure version number ("2012.1") in tarball name
messages:
[{'account_id': 308, 'date': '2011-11-04 21:09:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

The version should obviously not be 2012.1. I'm not sure this patch makes so much sense for stable/diablo, since that branch should have FINAL=True anyway."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-11-04 21:57:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Agree - should it be 2011.4 (final)?'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2011-11-05 20:08:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'd use 2011.3 (Final), or 1.0 (since it was set to 0.9 before)."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-11-06 00:00:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

2011.3 was our diablo tag: https://github.com/openstack/keystone/tags'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2011-11-07 09:10:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

OK, then given that the Diablo branch had version=0.9, I think this should have:

RELEASE_VERSION = "0.9"
RELEASE_VERSION_FINAL = True

or:
RELEASE_VERSION = "0.9.1"
RELEASE_VERSION_FINAL = True'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-11-07 17:59:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-11-07 18:03:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-11-07 19:42:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-07 19:43:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

commit_message:
Use pure version number ("2012.1") in tarball name

Makes setup.py use a canonical_version() function that returns the pure
(final) version number. That version number is used in tarball name and
as the main tarball directory. This brings Keystone in line with the
other core projects and needs to be in before Essex-1 delivery.

Change-Id: I8adb45ccc619a9a77d7a4da013d7cc9cf6277f86

commit_message:
Revised documentation build process (bug #843056)

- Manual method now produces docs in the same location as setup.py
- Added manual command to build man pages
- Manual method is now executable from the project root
  - To conform with similar commands
- Generated sourcecode rst's are now ignored by git
- Removed unused gitignore entries related to docs

Change-Id: I86fb38cdee957f5ba6717e1438494c7a148f4855

commit_message:
Blueprint lasterror

Add in a log report to nova-manage

Usages:

Get the last errors in the nova logs
    nova-manage logs errors

Get the last x nova messages in the syslog. The default is 10
    nova-manage logs syslog <x>

Change-Id: Id5d3a546051e25175b6523711f437618d07c3f19

subject: Add auto-reloading JSON config file support to scheduler.
messages:
[{'account_id': 688, 'date': '2011-11-03 13:34:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Hang on ... fixing commit message"}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2011-11-03 13:38:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2011-11-03 13:39:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2011-11-03 14:02:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

sorry ... merge cruft"}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2011-11-03 14:08:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-11-03 14:30:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

What about handling a SIGUSR1 or SIGHUP in nova-scheduler to reload configs? That way it could be at the deployer's discretion when the conf gets reloaded."}, {'account_id': 335, 'date': '2011-11-04 01:55:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

I think the signals could work, though I might think that you should be able to pick a timing of -1 for it to never reload. In our use case, I think 5 minutes is fine. 

I would rather see this go in sooner so we can experiment with the right approach. If 5 minutes becomes intolerable, then I might explore other options.'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-11-04 03:22:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

As a former Ops guy, I'd *well* prefer to kill -SIGHUP the nova-scheduler process to reload rather than the code attempting every X minutes. It really doesn't matter how often we make it, you just don't encounter many programs that do this (and you encounter a lot of programs that respond to SIGHUP) at least in my experience. When you want the config changed you're not going to want to wait 5 minutes because things will be impacted.

I won't hold this up by throwing up a negative, I just want to make sure the opinion is heard."}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2011-11-04 11:42:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2011-11-04 11:44:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

blamar, I hear ya ... I'm sure we'll make the necessary change once we get instances scheduling reliably. It's a great idea."}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-11-07 19:48:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Let's get this in then, the change is programmatically sound and tested so it's good with me."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-11-08 14:24:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, approved

Cool cool cool'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-08 14:40:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova/121810/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-merge/296/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-pep8/1669/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-08 14:40:33.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Add auto-reloading JSON config file support to scheduler.

This branch adds the ability to define a local JSON file that will hold
configuration information that the scheduler can use.

This dict will be passed into the filter and weighing functions so that
Operations can tweak the scheduler without having to bring down the scheduler
service.

Currently the polling time on the file is hardcoded at 5 minutes, but certainly
this could be made into a flag.

Next update will be to remove the host_filter and weighing_functions flags
and fix the scheduler to get these values from the config file.

Change-Id: Ia2487e933483761276058689fad84564d96a451e

commit_message:
Fix for launchpad bug #882568

Use tunctl to create the tap device if we are on a system where the ip command
is too old (and doesn't have support for tuntap).

Change-Id: I9e22010e4c7dd2671267de6d0e7a7bc9ae76a854

commit_message:
Removed autogenerated API .rst files.

Removed .rst files that are automatically generated using the nova_autodoc extension. It's not really worth keeping these in the repo since users can regenerate the files at will, and the content is also available at nova.openstack.org.

Change-Id: I6c93f9aae1994961fdca690742398a0d540d541f

commit_message:
Clean up docstrings for faults.Fault and it's usage

Many extensions wrapped exceptions manually with faults.Fault and ther
continues to be some confusion if it's necessary. This patch clears up
what faults.Fault does as well as documents that wsgi.Resource
automatically wraps webob.exc.HTTPException

Change-Id: Ieed63b8641499bc7449bae2684d5f63e5839d369

commit_message:
Improve access check on images

Makes sure that users can delete only their own images, snapshots.
Enable listing of all images, both private which are owned and the public
ones. Only list the private images/snapshots for the owner and admin users.
Fixes bug 863305

(cherry picked from commit cb37d895a6b97e294aa838f85227d29892f4e11e)

Change-Id: Idc15125371950e0c07b1dac48e8b844887fefc9d

commit_message:
Change floating-snat to float-snat

With iptables v1.4.10 I'm running into an issue with the chain length of the
"nova-dhcpbridge-floating-snat" table (iptables it complaining that the name
is too long; 28 chars max).  This shortens the name of that table.

Change-Id: I00b1003aaa0b3771c29d6459d07023a8caa47706

subject: Refactoring/cleanup of some view builders.
messages: [{'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-11-07 23:21:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned\n\nOOPS'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-07 23:21:03.000000000', 'message': 'Refactoring/cleanup of some view builders.

I have re-worked the "addresses", "flavors", "images", and "servers" view
builders to share logic which was previously duplicated across many ViewBuilder
classes. Also, I have re-worked the ViewBuilder class in general to persist
longer (meaning that a new ViewBuilder is not created for every request but
rather a single ViewBuilder is created and deals with each request as needed.)

During the re-factor I found an issue with test_servers.py where links were not
containing the project_id like they should. This was fixed and tests were updated.

Overall we had good test coverage so not many tests had to be updated during
the refactor.

(Patch Set 2) Updated _set_request and _get_request to be a request property
              and a set_request method which can be overridden.
(Patch Set 3) Fixed tests that I broke with the last update.
(Patch Set 4) Changed "id in network.keys()" to "id in network"
(Patch Set 5) Feedback changes from bcwaldon: Moved Controller to wsgi.py
              instead of common.py. Left ViewBuilder in common.py because
              wsgi.py can't import common (circular dep) and ViewBuilder
              needs common logic.

              Updated _resource_name to _collection_name.

              Updated the name of Controller._view_builder to
              Controller._view_builder_class and made it default to None.

              Removed prepare wrapper: request is passed around a lot more now
              which removes the need for the decorator but clutters the code
              a bit.

              Created test which utilizes 'floating' ips and made sure the
              logic which was in the old addresses builder was transfered.

Change-Id: I034404892018e99987f80789d7f7e406ff31658c

Created tests which has floating ips.

Change-Id: Id006ef28a0cf03899950d008e8124a8e34130910
'}]
commit_message:
Refactoring/cleanup of some view builders.

I have re-worked the "addresses", "flavors", "images", and "servers" view
builders to share logic which was previously duplicated across many ViewBuilder
classes. Also, I have re-worked the ViewBuilder class in general to persist
longer (meaning that a new ViewBuilder is not created for every request but
rather a single ViewBuilder is created and deals with each request as needed.)

During the re-factor I found an issue with test_servers.py where links were not
containing the project_id like they should. This was fixed and tests were updated.

Overall we had good test coverage so not many tests had to be updated during
the refactor.

(Patch Set 2) Updated _set_request and _get_request to be a request property
              and a set_request method which can be overridden.
(Patch Set 3) Fixed tests that I broke with the last update.
(Patch Set 4) Changed "id in network.keys()" to "id in network"
(Patch Set 5) Feedback changes from bcwaldon: Moved Controller to wsgi.py
              instead of common.py. Left ViewBuilder in common.py because
              wsgi.py can't import common (circular dep) and ViewBuilder
              needs common logic.

              Updated _resource_name to _collection_name.

              Updated the name of Controller._view_builder to
              Controller._view_builder_class and made it default to None.

              Removed prepare wrapper: request is passed around a lot more now
              which removes the need for the decorator but clutters the code
              a bit.

              Created test which utilizes 'floating' ips and made sure the
              logic which was in the old addresses builder was transfered.

Change-Id: I034404892018e99987f80789d7f7e406ff31658c

Created tests which has floating ips.

Change-Id: Id006ef28a0cf03899950d008e8124a8e34130910

A few more comments and responses to some of Dan's comments.  Also, one more thing:

I'm starting to think having all the deb packaging pieces is going to be annoying to maintain. I dislike the idea of using Alien but since we've got so many packages maybe we can go back to using it if it works.

Exception: Command "tools/build_rpms.sh plugins/cisco-plugin" failed.'}, {'account_id': 1549, 'date': '2011-11-07 22:11:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 233, 'date': '2011-11-07 22:11:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

The tests are still not passing.  Are you able to run them from the source tree without the packages installed?

The issues I'm seeing so far:

0) There is a duplicate tests directory under server/lib/quantum/tests (called tests)
1) The test extensions tests can't find their quantum.conf.test config file
2) test_cli tests can't find client_tools
3) test_database can't find test_database_stubs

We really need to fix these ASAP since the rest of the commits are waiting on this one to go in"}, {'account_id': 1549, 'date': '2011-11-07 22:11:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

subject: Re-architects the OpenStack Dashboard for modularity and extensibility.
messages:
[{'account_id': 1155, 'date': '2011-11-04 19:00:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Lots of D's and A's, which are really renames, so this changeset appears to destroy a lot of history."}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2011-11-05 03:42:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sad but true about the history. I'm not deeply knowledgeable about how Git decides on rename versus addition/deletion, but to the best of my knowledge there's a threshold of difference that it can handle in a file before it decides the the file is no longer the same.

Nothing in here is a deletion/addition just for the sake of moving it, though. Almost every file has undergone some degree of change ranging from massive to minor. A lot of files were broken up into smaller pieces because they were no longer manageable.

The only rename for a rename's sake was the "dash" -> "nova" dashbaord rename, and that was at the request of Devin.

So, yes, the history is broken at this merge, but not lost. You just have to go digging to look through the commit history to see where things were before if you weren't around prior to the change. In most large projects if you go far enough back in the history there are changes like this that needed to happen that damaged the history in the early days. It's part of growing up, or something. ;-)'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2011-11-05 19:46:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

This is a mother of a review! I think it actually breaks Gerrit around the messages.po pages - I tried to review the whole thing just inside Gerrit.

It looks good to me, but the change was so expansive that I may have easily missed something.'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2011-11-07 21:00:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 543, 'date': '2011-11-07 21:07:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Extensibility FTW!'}, {'account_id': 1205, 'date': '2011-11-07 21:57:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, approved

Loving the organization for this, nice work. lgtm/approve!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-07 21:57:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-horizon-pep8/16/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-07 21:57:08.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-04 02:29:21.000000000', 'message': 'Re-architects the OpenStack Dashboard for modularity and extensibility.

Implements blueprint extensible-architecture.
Implements blueprint improve-dev-documentation.
Implements blueprint gettext-everywhere.
Implements blueprint sphinx-docs.

Complete re-architecture of the dashboard to transform it from a standalone django-openstack app to a Horizon framework for building dashboards. See the docs for more information.

Incidentally fixes the following bugs:

Fixes bug 845868 -- no PEP8 violations.
Fixes bug 766096 -- the dashboard can now be installed at any arbitrary URL.
Fixes bug 879111 -- tenant id is now controlled solely by the tenant switcher, not the url (which was disregarded anyway)
Fixes bug 794754 -- output of venv installation is considerably reduced.

Due to the scale and scope of this patch I recommend reviewing it on github: https://github.com/gabrielhurley/horizon/tree/extensible_architecture

Change-Id: I8e63f7ea235f904247df40c33cb66338d973df9e

Fixes bug 794754 -- output of venv installation is considerably reduced.

commit_message:
Re-architects the OpenStack Dashboard for modularity and extensibility.

Implements blueprint extensible-architecture.
Implements blueprint improve-dev-documentation.
Implements blueprint gettext-everywhere.
Implements blueprint sphinx-docs.

Complete re-architecture of the dashboard to transform it from a standalone django-openstack app to a Horizon framework for building dashboards. See the docs for more information.

Incidentally fixes the following bugs:

Fixes bug 845868 -- no PEP8 violations.
Fixes bug 766096 -- the dashboard can now be installed at any arbitrary URL.
Fixes bug 879111 -- tenant id is now controlled solely by the tenant switcher, not the url (which was disregarded anyway)
Fixes bug 794754 -- output of venv installation is considerably reduced.

Due to the scale and scope of this patch I recommend reviewing it on github: https://github.com/gabrielhurley/horizon/tree/extensible_architecture

Change-Id: I8e63f7ea235f904247df40c33cb66338d973df9e

   Open a bug for monty/jeblair after this patch?

   It could be easily revised to init from diablo though, if desired.
- Preconfigured (default) manage.py shortcut is in the project root
   I couldn't find the matching file in nova to match their setup (?)"}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2011-10-28 22:44:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The one at the root of the project is basically pre-configured for development purposes. I wouldn't advertise *this* version in the admin docs for the reasons you mention."}, {'account_id': 5, 'date': '2011-10-29 18:31:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, approved

Build Unstable

https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/keystone-merge/304/ : SUCCESS"}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-10-31 16:50:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-10-31 16:51:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

PEP8 & pylint fixes (including local ignore for C0103)'}, {'account_id': 1228, 'date': '2011-10-31 17:31:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2011-10-31 17:51:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-31 19:29:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(1 inline comment)

Hey Dolph, I don't think you want manage.py in the root dir like you have here...

Also, you might want to add a test case for migrations. Glance has some you should be able to use with a little modification.

Cheers!
-jay"}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-10-31 20:42:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-10-31 20:48:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

@Joe @Jay: I removed the manage.py in the root directory, as it was obviously a source of confusion. It was simply intended to be a shortcut to reduce:

    python keystone/backends/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/manage.py test --url=sqlite:///test_migrations.db --repository=keystone/backends/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/

... down to:

    python manage.py test

We'll just need to document the long form of the command for contributors, and get it running as a separate job on Jenkins.

@ Jay, I like the idea of being able to unit test individual migrations, but there's a lot of overhead in the glance code to make that happen, and we don't have a need for it (today). I'd rather use the simple, built-in method for testing migrations until then.

-1 because this patch does not completely satisfy bug 881794 (new). Additionally, I'll document the above command in the next patch."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-31 21:43:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

OK, Dolph, makes sense. Thanks for the reply! :)

-jay'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-11-01 15:28:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-11-01 15:32:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

This patch adds a little documentation, and migrations to bring our Diablo release up to do date with trunk.

HOWEVER, and this is a Fun Fact(tm), while manually upgrade/downgrading works great:

    python keystone/backends/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/manage.py version_control --url=sqlite:///test_migrations.db --repository=keystone/backends/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/

    python keystone/backends/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/manage.py upgrade --url=sqlite:///test_migrations.db --repository=keystone/backends/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/

    python keystone/backends/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/manage.py downgrade 0 --url=sqlite:///test_migrations.db --repository=keystone/backends/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/

The built-in tests now fail:

    python keystone/backends/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/manage.py test --url=sqlite:///test_migrations.db --repository=keystone/backends/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/

... and it looks like this command is trying to run the third migration without running the first two?'}, {'account_id': 8, 'date': '2011-11-04 20:34:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1228, 'date': '2011-11-04 20:36:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Track post-Diablo database evolution using migrations (BP: database-migrations)

- Added SQLAlchemy Migrations as a dependency (pip install sqlalchemy-migrate)
- Added empty migration repo
- Made migration manage.py executable
- Added initial migration matching diablo-tagged release
- Added incremental migrations to catch up to trunk
- Added usage docs for contributors
- Added doc that explains how to migrate.

Change-Id: I4fa8f930645ac6b7f82d0472361fe114b71bb489

subject: Adds option to encrypt 'location' metadata.
messages:
[{'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-28 17:27:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(6 inline comments)

I do want to point out that this branch adds encryption/decryption only to the api server, not the registry server. This means that every api server has to be configured with the same encryption key, otherwise they won't be able to understand images added by other api servers.

I do want to play the devil's advocate here and pose this question: why not just use API <-> Registry SSL? We already support that and doesn't require us to add any more code.

Also, please see my inline comments."}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2011-11-02 14:55:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-11-02 18:28:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(4 inline comments)

Thanks for the extra work, Stuart. There are a few things you still need to address, though:

1) Add 'pycrypto' to tools/pip-requires.
2) There are a handful of pep8 errors. Use 'run_tests.sh -p' to run just the pep8 check.
3) See my inline comments

I also ran *all* of the functional tests and they all passed, just so you know."}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2011-11-03 17:27:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-11-03 19:36:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks good, Stuart!'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-03 23:07:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (3 inline comments)

Code looks good to me, but I have a couple of concerns I'd like you to at least comment on..."}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2011-11-07 16:42:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (3 inline comments)

Kevin -- Thanks for checking through my code. I've replied to your comments."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-07 16:51:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, approved

(3 inline comments)

(In-line comments are just me reiterating what was said in private email, to preserve history)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-11-07 16:51:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Adds option to encrypt 'location' metadata.

Implements blueprint swift-location-credentials

When the new option is enabled the location metadata
(which may include user credentials) is encrypted
before being sent to the registry server.

Change-Id: I072e3f5c81f187435b1c156627076d5fde087af5

commit_message:
Refactored version attributes

- Promoted the api version status from 'alpha' to 'beta'
- Adopted openstack release names in lieu of arbitrary version #'s

Change-Id: I23d58fa7417886cceb09d740efa99bc276b435d8

[{'created': '2011-11-04 20:48:52.000000000', 'message': "Improved CLI error feedback (bug 877504)

- Renamed 'commands' to 'actions' to avoid confusion
- Fixed: --help not showing usage options
- Fixed: lists of 'objects' and 'actions' were out of date
  - They are now generated at runtime

Change-Id: I055ae6c40d846efa3cea96f822aa6bec02afdfd2
"}]
commit_message:
Improved CLI error feedback (bug 877504)

- Renamed 'commands' to 'actions' to avoid confusion
- Fixed: --help not showing usage options
- Fixed: lists of 'objects' and 'actions' were out of date
  - They are now generated at runtime

Change-Id: I055ae6c40d846efa3cea96f822aa6bec02afdfd2

messages:
[{'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-10-19 20:42:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks correct to me. Great catch Asbjørn!'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-10-19 20:43:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For the record, the regression was introduced by eb03d47fecd'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-10-19 20:45:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Oh, also - it'd be good to get a test case for this"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2011-10-19 20:46:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

yes a test case would be great.'}, {'account_id': 1792, 'date': '2011-10-21 09:22:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2011-10-21 16:34:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Thanks for the test, although this is generally a different approach than we generally use for overriding a method.  We usually use stubout.  Something like the following:

iff --git a/nova/tests/test_libvirt.py b/nova/tests/test_libvirt.py
index 1551972..8507ff2 100644
--- a/nova/tests/test_libvirt.py
+++ b/nova/tests/test_libvirt.py
@@ -1081,21 +1081,18 @@ class LibvirtConnTestCase(test.TestCase):
         already been destroyed.
         """
 
-        class LibvirtConnectionTester(connection.LibvirtConnection):
-            """
-            Dummy class we use to check if destroy handles already
-            destroyed instances.
-            """
-
-            def _lookup_by_name(self, instance_name):
-                """Always raise not found"""
-                raise exception.InstanceNotFound(instance_id=instance_name)
+        def fake_lookup(instance_name):
+            """Always raise not found"""
+            raise exception.InstanceNotFound(instance_id=instance_name)
 
         instance = {
             'id': 'doesnotmatter',
             'name': 'doesnotmatter'
             }
-        conn = LibvirtConnectionTester(False)
+        conn = connection.LibvirtConnection(False)
+        self.stubs.Set(conn,
+                       '_lookup_by_name',
+                       fake_lookup)
         conn.destroy(instance, [], cleanup=False)'}, {'account_id': 1792, 'date': '2011-10-23 12:16:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-10-24 19:44:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Looks good to me... but it looks like you'll need to add yourself to Authors file..  I'm not seeing you listed?"}, {'account_id': 1792, 'date': '2011-10-25 20:07:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-11-03 19:56:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Do not submit

I'm sorry I didn't notice this review sooner, but I filed a bug and fixed this same issue here: https://review.openstack.org/#change,1236. Again, I'm sorry to snatch this from you!"}, {'account_id': 1792, 'date': '2011-11-06 09:54:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

At least the bug is fixed and pushed out.'}]

commit_message:
Fix deletion of instances without a domain.

Indent domain removal to only be ran when it is not None.

When trying to remove failed instances I got the following trace:
(nova.rpc): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/rpc/impl_kombu.py", line 620, in _process_data
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     rval = node_func(context=ctxt, **node_args)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/exception.py", line 113, in wrapped
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     return f(*args, **kw)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/compute/manager.py", line 119, in decorated_function
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     function(self, context, instance_id, *args, **kwargs)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/compute/manager.py", line 569, in terminate_instance
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     self._delete_instance(context, instance_id)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/compute/manager.py", line 546, in _delete_instance
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     self._shutdown_instance(context, instance_id, 'Terminating', True)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/compute/manager.py", line 532, in _shutdown_instance
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     self.driver.destroy(instance, network_info, block_device_info, cleanup)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/virt/libvirt/connection.py", line 311, in destroy
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     virt_dom.undefine()
(nova.rpc): TRACE: AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'undefine'

Which is fixed by this commit.

For the record the regression was introduced by eb03d47fecd.

Added myself to the Authors file, as requested.

Change-Id: I6d299332953db07884ed61e3645e0f62fdd94505

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-04 20:48:50.000000000', 'message': 'Fix possible_topdir computing

Using sys.argv[0] is wrong: if you run /usr/bin/keystone, it will look for
templates in /usr/keystone/… which will not work. The template path is
relative to the version.py file, so using __file__ makes things work.

Change-Id: I90e930bbb320b148df0fb7234a824b3644bd7369
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien.danjou@enovance.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix possible_topdir computing

Using sys.argv[0] is wrong: if you run /usr/bin/keystone, it will look for
templates in /usr/keystone/… which will not work. The template path is
relative to the version.py file, so using __file__ makes things work.

Change-Id: I90e930bbb320b148df0fb7234a824b3644bd7369
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien.danjou@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Don't update database before resize

Fixes bug lp885815 by ensuring the scheduler doesn't update the database with destination host.  Compute manager now updates upon completion of resize.

Change-Id: I3f9ac664c8807e8523802e2485d316a731190764

commit_message:
Bug #884930 Support/Remove additional calls for for Tenant.
- Supported call to get users for a tenant for a specific role.
- Removed calls to get specific role for a user and to get
all the roles for a specific tenant as they are not useful.
- Fixed LDAP backend call to get users for a tenant.
- Disabling Invalid pylint check.

Change-Id: I8c9dbc206d06a55e5c5ddc1163680103563eacc4

messages:
[{'account_id': 1635, 'date': '2011-10-26 19:55:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2011-10-27 14:39:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This looks good, but if I remember correctly, saying things like "partially fixes bug XXX" or even "doesn't fix bug XXX" will cause automated tools to mark bug XXX as fix committed. If that is not what you want to have happen with this patch, you should change the commit message.'}, {'account_id': 1635, 'date': '2011-10-27 19:55:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Is the keyword "fixes"? I do want to associate this fix with the bug. The rest of it will be in openstack-manuals repo. What is the appropriate course of action?'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2011-10-28 14:51:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Hi Renuka, the key word is "bug" - I can log a second bug for the cloud admin docs. 

Also, the file name shouldn't be nova..volume.xensm.rst, the files named like that are autogenerated. Please rename it xensmvolume.rst. 

Also edit the devguide/index.rst to add a link to xensmvolume.rst so it'll be easily accessible from the dev guide.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2011-10-28 14:54:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

commit_message:
Log original dropped exception when a new exception occurs

If a exception is caught while processing a previous exception, make sure
to log it so it doesn't silently get discarded

Change-Id: Ic887db9c2592229970737daf5dd9732b2258877b

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-03 12:22:00.000000000', 'message': "Fix two issues with checked_iter

 The error message raised by IOError needed %locals() added

 If there is no cache in the pipeline image_meta['size'] appears to be of
 type str on my system. Thus the compare of expected_size and bytes_written
 always failed even when the values should have matched.
 Unconditionally convert expected_size to int to resolve this.
 Curiously image_meta['size'] is of type int if the cache is in the pipeline.
 This latter fix could be removed if the typing is resolved

Change-Id: I05eadce2b5ceb8eb7939acb41668aff089270e21
"}, {'created': '2011-11-03 14:00:04.000000000', 'message': "Fix LP Bug#885696 two issues with checked_iter

 The error message raised by IOError needed %locals() added

 If there is no cache in the pipeline image_meta['size'] appears to be of
 type str on my system. Thus the compare of expected_size and bytes_written
 always failed even when the values should have matched.
 Unconditionally convert expected_size to int to resolve this.
 Curiously image_meta['size'] is of type int if the cache is in the pipeline.
 This latter fix could be removed if the typing is resolved

Change-Id: I05eadce2b5ceb8eb7939acb41668aff089270e21
"}]
commit_message:
Fix LP Bug#885696 two issues with checked_iter

 The error message raised by IOError needed %locals() added

 If there is no cache in the pipeline image_meta['size'] appears to be of
 type str on my system. Thus the compare of expected_size and bytes_written
 always failed even when the values should have matched.
 Unconditionally convert expected_size to int to resolve this.
 Curiously image_meta['size'] is of type int if the cache is in the pipeline.
 This latter fix could be removed if the typing is resolved

Change-Id: I05eadce2b5ceb8eb7939acb41668aff089270e21

Is NotImplemented raised or InvalidRequest, I assumed they were different; but the comment is confusing.

Thanks'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-10-07 21:41:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Couldn't this be done by removing/commenting out the "filter:adminrequest" section in paste config? It seems like there are 2 configuration files here and I'd rather just rely on one.

That being said we do have a flag like this for the OSAPI, but I'd be a fan of removing it unless there are reasons for being able to configure this sort of thing from multiple config files.'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2011-10-13 12:17:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

To address Brian's comment - I think a flag is better in this case as it is more obvious to OpenStack implementors as something that can/should be configured (whereas the paste file can be used out of the box in most cases).  AFAIK the EC2 admin interface isn't documented anywhere, but is something that should be disabled by default."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-10-14 02:01:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Brian: I like using the flag. 

Approve.'}, {'account_id': 335, 'date': '2011-11-03 03:57:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Does this need a remerge? I see this failing our smoketests.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-11-03 13:41:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Pvo: if by 'smoketests' you mean 'smokestack', the tests will fail there since this requires a paste config change"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-11-03 13:48:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Brian: Actually it just requires a nova.conf change to enable the EC2 admin access which is required for the smoketest to pass.

Pvo: When this lands I'll make the adjustment in the Chef Cookbooks and Smokestack so trunk will pass (I've already got those BTW). I think this change should be fine."}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-11-03 14:36:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, approved

commit_message:
Enable admin access to EC2 API server

Add a flag which allows you to enable or disable EC2 admin api through
nova flag. Is is similar to allow_admin_api for OS API.
Fixes bug 869908.

Change-Id: I0c786f7cd5f5c3470edc23f0b9b84e5dff1714e2

[{'created': '2011-09-26 07:59:11.000000000', 'message': 'Adds melange to nova

Implements blueprint Melange - IP Address Management Service (https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/melange-ipam)

Melange is currently an IP or L3 management service, but will probably expand into more of a "network identifier" management service which may include L2 data in the future.
This commit contains basic set of features like IpBlocks and IpAddresses that work with quantum network manager. It leverages nova infrastructures like wsgi and utils wherever applicable.

Change-Id: I842dcfa36cfa7dad874bdb908b25b22bdd109eba

Melange is currently an IP or L3 management service, but will probably expand into more of a "network identifier" management service which may include L2 data in the future.

commit_message:
Adds melange to nova

Implements blueprint Melange - IP Address Management Service (https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/melange-ipam)

Melange is currently an IP or L3 management service, but will probably expand into more of a "network identifier" management service which may include L2 data in the future.
This commit contains basic set of features like IpBlocks and IpAddresses that work with quantum network manager. It leverages nova infrastructures like wsgi and utils wherever applicable.

Change-Id: I842dcfa36cfa7dad874bdb908b25b22bdd109eba

commit_message:
Speed up tests yet another 45 seconds

This changes the security groups extension tests to use the Controllers
directly, bypassing the slow wsgi setup process. This is part 2 of this
patch and contains the majority of the changes. The code required more
changes than the other test suite speedups because of how the previous
code was written and as a result, the diff is kind of long. As a bonus,
there is a net removal of almost 150 lines.

Change-Id: I7893cf16092ce58860607fd4ab2df10550fe3270

commit_message:
Fixes LP Bug#885434 - Documentation showing multiple tenants misleading

While the Keystone API Spec supports multiple tenants, the Keystone
implementation does not. The samples have been simplified to show
only one tenant returned.

Change-Id: I6aecb603cab83a4fb987a2cdaddbd366443615ec

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-01 18:59:27.000000000', 'message': "Bug 884863: nova logs everything to syslog twice

Fix double-registration of the syslog handler.
NovaRootLogger.setup_from_flags is called twice from log.setup() -- once
through NovaRootLogger.__init__ and once through reset().  setup_from_flags
wasn't idempotent, so this resulted in the syslog handler being registered
twice.

Rather than fix the twisty-turny maze that is setup(), I've opted to make
setup_from_flags idempotent in this regard, by always unregistering the
syslog handler before doing anything else.

Change-Id: I59ad61751e1a19d2cbb73dc1deea9c708d4c5032
"}]
commit_message:
Bug 884863: nova logs everything to syslog twice

Fix double-registration of the syslog handler.
NovaRootLogger.setup_from_flags is called twice from log.setup() -- once
through NovaRootLogger.__init__ and once through reset().  setup_from_flags
wasn't idempotent, so this resulted in the syslog handler being registered
twice.

Rather than fix the twisty-turny maze that is setup(), I've opted to make
setup_from_flags idempotent in this regard, by always unregistering the
syslog handler before doing anything else.

Change-Id: I59ad61751e1a19d2cbb73dc1deea9c708d4c5032

commit_message:
Fixes LP Bug#885529 - NameError on _ function

Some tools don't install gettext (such as dashboard)
and therefore when they import glance.common modules,
they get a NameError because _ is undefined.

Change-Id: I890e5f2a7d8cb7ebf256b2e854d24e80f26a05da

Looks good. Included a suggestion for a small simplification.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2011-11-03 00:09:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-11-03 01:30:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I'm more of a fan of plan (a) "add the context object to as many logs as possible" for fixing bug 879582.

We're coupling more and more to eventlet with changes like this, although I suppose we could make nova/local.py use threading locals or some other local-ish implementation. 

It is 110% easier than adding a bunch of logging changes and I don't have any suggestions for immediate improvement so I'm good with it.'}, {'account_id': 335, 'date': '2011-11-03 02:21:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, approved

commit_message:
Add local storage of context for logging

 * adds nova/local.py:store for storing greenthread local data
 * saves a weak reference to the last context object created
 * uses the last context object if it exists for logging
 * Fixes bug 879582

Cc: stable-maintainers
Change-Id: Ic373556ce197f2e8e7d23c807a65b12111db96eb

commit_message:
Reserve memory/disk for dom0/host OS

Only when scheduling with distributed scheduler for now.

Adds flags:

flags.DEFINE_integer('reserved_host_disk_mb', 0,
        'Amount of disk in MB to reserve for host/dom0')
flags.DEFINE_integer('reserved_host_memory_mb', 512,
        'Amount of memory in MB to reserve for host/dom0')

Change-Id: Ib9b8a4deca241db399a8541ab21697ab08e29dd6

commit_message:
Use pure version number ("2012.1") in tarball name

Makes setup.py use a canonical_version() function that returns the pure
(final) version number. That version number is used in tarball name and
as the main tarball directory. This brings Keystone in line with the
other core projects and needs to be in before Essex-1 delivery.

Change-Id: I8adb45ccc619a9a77d7a4da013d7cc9cf6277f86

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-02 18:41:33.000000000', 'message': "APIs should not wait on scheduler for builds in single zone deployment

Fixes bug 885349

We can short circuit waiting on the scheduler if we're in a single zone
deployment and only building 1 instance.  This patch checks for that
case and creates the instance DB entry directly in the API (in
compute/api) without the call to the scheduler.

Change-Id: I98b27156167f057d11fbc56a9ff99d4e2ec423d3
"}, {'created': '2011-11-02 18:56:02.000000000', 'message': "APIs should not wait on scheduler for builds in single zone deployment

Fixes bug 885349

We can short circuit waiting on the scheduler if we're in a single zone
deployment and only building 1 instance.  This patch checks for that
case and creates the instance DB entry directly in the API (in
compute/api) without the call to the scheduler.

Change-Id: I98b27156167f057d11fbc56a9ff99d4e2ec423d3
"}]
commit_message:
APIs should not wait on scheduler for builds in single zone deployment

Fixes bug 885349

We can short circuit waiting on the scheduler if we're in a single zone
deployment and only building 1 instance.  This patch checks for that
case and creates the instance DB entry directly in the API (in
compute/api) without the call to the scheduler.

Change-Id: I98b27156167f057d11fbc56a9ff99d4e2ec423d3

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-11-01 21:06:02.000000000', 'message': 'Drop extra XML tests and remove _json suffix from names

This is the first step in moving this part of the test suite to using
Controllers directly, bypassing wsgi. After these patches get merged,
tests should end up getting sped up by about 45 seconds.

This is the first in a set of smaller merges that should hopefully
make the original 1200 line patch easier to review.

Change-Id: Ib2849f64220bf2efa333cd739bafdd241348a4a4
'}]
commit_message:
Drop extra XML tests and remove _json suffix from names

This is the first step in moving this part of the test suite to using
Controllers directly, bypassing wsgi. After these patches get merged,
tests should end up getting sped up by about 45 seconds.

This is the first in a set of smaller merges that should hopefully
make the original 1200 line patch easier to review.

Change-Id: Ib2849f64220bf2efa333cd739bafdd241348a4a4

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-10-28 18:27:37.000000000', 'message': 'Too much information is returned from POST /servers

Currently we're returning a lot of information in the POST /servers
response. This isn't according to spec and is misleading to other
projects that might try and implement the OpenStack API specification.

The example on docs.openstack.com for the v1.1 API says:

"Note that when creating a server only the server ID, its links, and
the admin password are guaranteed to be returned in the request.
Additional attributes may be retrieved by performing subsequent GETs
on the server."

We're returning too much right now and this patch addresses that.

Further patches should be submitted to refactor the 'view builder'
concept as using keyword arguments like this patch does is not ideal
and I recognize that.

Change-Id: If246e51dbf84f1db3d2905694235692ab027859d

commit_message:
Too much information is returned from POST /servers

Currently we're returning a lot of information in the POST /servers
response. This isn't according to spec and is misleading to other
projects that might try and implement the OpenStack API specification.

The example on docs.openstack.com for the v1.1 API says:

"Note that when creating a server only the server ID, its links, and
the admin password are guaranteed to be returned in the request.
Additional attributes may be retrieved by performing subsequent GETs
on the server."

We're returning too much right now and this patch addresses that.

Further patches should be submitted to refactor the 'view builder'
concept as using keyword arguments like this patch does is not ideal
and I recognize that.

(Patch Set 2) Merged with master + conflict fix
(Patch Set 3) Reverted non-nova-standard superclass call

Change-Id: If246e51dbf84f1db3d2905694235692ab027859d
