subject: Glance redirect support for clients.
messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-24 21:49:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(1 inline comment)

One teeny femto-nit, but other than that, this is great work, Brian! Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-10-24 22:08:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-25 14:49:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Brian: question for ya in the client code...'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-25 21:28:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-10-26 16:37:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (3 inline comments)

A couple of nits.  Also, doesn't httplib2 handle redirects directly?  Any reason we couldn't migrate the client to using httplib2 instead of handling the redirects ourself?"}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-10-31 21:20:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (4 inline comments)

Replied to comments. I'll have a new branch in soon which addresses at least the args[0] -> self change suggested by Vek."}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-10-31 21:23:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Another update to redact something that I didn't quite get. Thanks for the review Vek."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-10-31 21:30:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

See inline comments...'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-10-31 21:34:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Kevin Mitchell

1) I'd call migrating to httplib2 a big decision and a huge change. If you look at the _do_request method in the BaseClient class you'll see that we have a lot of coupling to the httplib library (httplib2 isn't a drop-in replacement). My first thought was to refactor BaseClient to reduce our HTTP library coupling...but it was a pretty tall order.

2) I hear what you're saying about re-usability of the handle_redirects decorator, and I'm 100% open for suggestions. This wrapper isn't meant to be reused outside of this class and I could have just as easily  have implemented the decorator in the do_request() method where _do_request() is called.

Normally decorators are generically wrapped around method...this one just happens to be very specific because of how the class is designed. Ideally self.configure_from_url would be all I'd need to call but since the path is not stored within the class and needs to be passed in, mangling needs to occur. I can look at some subtle refactoring to see if I can avoid this."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-10-31 21:43:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yeah, I know migrating to httplib2 is a tall order; I did that for my requiem library (a REST client builder), and even though it had a lot less coupling than glance does, it took some careful thought.  However, httplib2 does have the redirect problem taken care of, so it seems to me that--long-term, at least--we should consider trying to move to it.  Maybe it'll turn out to not be possible, but it's something worth raising while we consider this patch."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-31 21:45:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

httplib2 does not support chunked-transfer encoding in the way we need, AFAIK. That's why we didn't use it...

-jay"}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-10-31 21:47:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-10-31 21:53:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Jay: Ah ha, that's kinda what I was fishing for.  Good to know!"}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-11-01 18:09:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-11-01 19:59:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

well played.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-01 20:11:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, approved

(Patch Set 3) Updated to slightly refactor the _do_request call based
              on the greate feedback which pointed out after a redirect is
              encountered the client will still be 'pointed' to the redirect's
              host/port/etc. This issue should be solved now and test written.

(Patch Set 4) Fixed PEP8 issue

Change-Id: I95a93eb0d920ce57d260423d130eae178705eca3
"}]
commit_message:
Glance redirect support for clients.

Includes functional tests, and small re-working of the BaseClient class.

(Patch Set 2) Updated wrapped to be more explicit about what it is doing.
              To be clear, this is not a general-purpose decorator but a
              specific decorator for the _do_request method of BaseClient.

(Patch Set 3) Updated to slightly refactor the _do_request call based
              on the greate feedback which pointed out after a redirect is
              encountered the client will still be 'pointed' to the redirect's
              host/port/etc. This issue should be solved now and test written.

(Patch Set 4) Fixed PEP8 issue

Change-Id: I95a93eb0d920ce57d260423d130eae178705eca3

commit_message:
Support using server uuids when accessing consoles.

This adds support to the nova/console/api.py for instance_ids
being uuids. Additionally, it updates the openstack console
controller to get around some int() casts and modifies testing
to exercise the server-uuid path.

Change-Id: I0641f2c4857d0d1e07abc7d70880590741769b9a

Some minor stuff for now inline.  I need to spend a little more time with this, but have to move on to some other things ATM.."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2011-10-28 17:11:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The host memory calculation is (still) based on feedback from the compute node. Unfortunately, not all compute nodes can accurately account for their utilization due to sparse memory allocation, this is particularly true with qemu/kvm.  The host information returned by libvirt/connection.py is essentially useless for scheduling and there are no clear methods of improving *that* side of the equation. Meanwhile, we do have this information stored in the database and a method that can already calculate the host memory utilization based on this (assert_compute_node_has_enough_memory).

I don't feel the above need be addressed by a separate  bug/blueprint as this patch largely touches upon the data structures and the methods used to manage the host info, besides adding checks that are worth nothing to a large number of users."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-10-28 17:24:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
flatten distributed scheduler

This branch removes AbstractScheduler, BaseScheduler and LeastCostScheduler
and replaces it with DistributedScheduler. Now the points of extension are
handled via the --default_host_filters and --least_cost_functions only.

Also, greatly simplified the zone handling logic in DistibutedScheduler, mostly
by removing the cryptic dicts with helper classes.

Fixed up the Least Cost functions to better deal with multiple functions.
(In a followup patch I will removed the normalization that occurs as this will
be a problem).

Tests were mostly rewritten to support this new world order.

Debated removing JSONFilter since it's not accessible from the outside world,
but decided to keep it as there are discussions afoot on making scheduler
changes without having to redeploy code or restart services.

HostFilters once again get the all the host service capabilities, but now
via a HostInfo class that mostly contains read-only dicts of capabilities.

Virtual resource consumption is done in the DistributedScheduler class now.
The filters/weighing functions don't need to worry about this. Also, weighing
functions only have to return a single host and not worry about the number of
instances requested.

Change-Id: I92600a4a9c58b1add775c328a18d8f48c305861e

subject: Consolidate glance.utils into glance.common.utils
messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-11-01 16:19:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

w00t.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-11-01 16:21:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The thing that most bothers me is that we keep entangling the client more with the server; this refactoring seems to make that a little worse, in that now the client additionally needs common/wsgi.py.  (Of course, it already needed api/v1/images.py, which needed common/wsgi.py, but now we have an explicit dependency.)  Ideally, we'd have a client that could easily be packaged totally separately from the server, pulling in only the base_client, maybe exceptions, and some utils.  All this to say—is there any way we can pull some of the stuff you stuffed into wsgi.py into common/utils.py?"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-11-01 16:28:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

subject: Fix lp:861160 -- newly created network has no uuid
messages:
[{'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-10-19 11:43:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Okay, I think this is generally the right thing to do - we don't appear to be generating an UUID for networks anywhere and we assign UUIDs for instances in a similar way to what this patch adds

Two changes I'd like to see though:

  1) instance_create() allows the supplied values to
     overwrite the UUID. I'm  not sure if this is really
     intentional or relied upon, but there's no reason
     to do it differently for networks

     i.e. do gen_uuid() *before* calling update()

  2) we need a test case to check that the UUID is
     always generated when networks are created

     e.g. in test_servers.py we stub out gen_uuid, make
     it return FAKE_UUID and check that the instance is
     created with this

  3) Add yourself to Authors; without this the unit
     tests will fail"}, {'account_id': 1633, 'date': '2011-10-21 14:14:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-10-21 20:18:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

[{'created': '2011-10-28 23:38:12.000000000', 'message': 'More cache refactoring - Management Middleware

Fixes LP Bug#883236 - Cache management needs refactoring

Refactors cache management middleware by simplifying
the middleware to image cache calls. The middleware
now only contains calls for retrieving records of
which images are cached, queueing an image to be
cached, deleting a single cached image, and deleting
all cached images. I removed the special calls for
reaping invalid or stalled images, as that is handled
by the cache cleaner utility...

Adds functional test case with caching and cache
management middleware enabled.

Made a slight change to the way the functional test
creates a config file: now it adds the configuration
files used to start servers to $TEST_DIR/etc/$SERVER.conf
so that test runner can see the config files that
caused failures for tests.

TODO: Add test case for queue, then run prefetcher, then
check image is cached...
TODO: Add docs for cache management API
TODO: Make bin/glance gracefully handle cache not existing

Change-Id: I76e95ffeeabc079b48b5ce2aeb6520cbdbf6d1e1

commit_message:
More cache refactoring - Management Middleware

Fixes LP Bug#883236 - Cache management needs refactoring

Refactors cache management middleware by simplifying
the middleware to image cache calls. The middleware
now only contains calls for retrieving records of
which images are cached, queueing an image to be
cached, deleting a single cached image, and deleting
all cached images. I removed the special calls for
reaping invalid or stalled images, as that is handled
by the cache cleaner utility...

Adds functional test case with caching and cache
management middleware enabled.

Made a slight change to the way the functional test
creates a config file: now it adds the configuration
files used to start servers to $TEST_DIR/etc/$SERVER.conf
so that test runner can see the config files that
caused failures for tests.

TODO: Add test case for queue, then run prefetcher, then
check image is cached...
TODO: Add docs for cache management API
TODO: Make bin/glance gracefully handle cache not existing

Change-Id: I76e95ffeeabc079b48b5ce2aeb6520cbdbf6d1e1
